analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /

analyzed: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba /

analyzed: so sor rab tu gnas pa dang / thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke to the gods of the Pure Abodes:

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Gods,

original: khyad cag nyon cig /
analyzed: khyad cag nyon cig /
translated: listen well!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i cho 'phrul gyi spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i cho 'phrul gyi spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: The youthful Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, has inconceivable magical conduct.

original: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba /
analyzed: ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba /
translated: It is a marvelous and wondrous

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor byang @54a *//
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor byang @54a *//
translated: maṇḍala of samādhi, miracles, and liberations.

original: chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho ba /
analyzed: chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho ba /
translated: It is the magical emanation of bodhisattvas and the sustenance of all bodhisattvas.

original: tshe dang / nad med pa dang / dbang phyug dang / yid la bsams pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i sngags kyi gzhi dag sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: tshe dang / nad med pa dang / dbang phyug dang / yid la bsams pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i sngags kyi gzhi dag sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: It is the basis of the mantra that brings about the fulfillment of the wishes of sentient beings, namely, long life, good health, power, and the fulfillment of all mental wishes.

original: de shin tu legs par nyon la zungs shig dang ngas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de shin tu legs par nyon la zungs shig dang ngas bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind, and I will explain it.”

original: de nas gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu de dag gis thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la lags so zhes gsol te /
analyzed: de nas gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu de dag gis thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la lags so zhes gsol te /
translated: Then the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm bowed with palms joined and said to the Blessed One, “Excellent!”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par dang / sa chen po thob par bya ba dang / rdo rje'i gdan gnon pa dang / bdud gdul ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / nyan thos dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par dang / sa chen po thob par bya ba dang / rdo rje'i gdan gnon pa dang / bdud gdul ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / nyan thos dang /
translated: the conduct of the bodhisattvas, the special samādhis, the attainment of the great grounds, the subjugation of the vajra seat, the taming of Māra, the turning of the wheel of Dharma, the nirvāṇa of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi nges par 'byung ba dang / lha rnams dang / mi rnams su skye bar bya ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / dbul ba dang / nad rnams zhi bar byed pa /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi nges par 'byung ba dang / lha rnams dang / mi rnams su skye bar bya ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / dbul ba dang / nad rnams zhi bar byed pa /
translated: birth as a god or human, the pacification of suffering, poverty, and sickness,

original: longs spyod kyis phyug pa 'dren par byed pa /
analyzed: longs spyod kyis phyug pa 'dren par byed pa /
translated: the attraction of wealth,

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags kyi spyod pas phongs par mi byed pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags kyi spyod pas phongs par mi byed pa /
translated: the nondeprivation of mundane and supramundane mantra conduct,

original: re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: the fulfillment of all wishes,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung 'bras bu med par byed pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung 'bras bu med par byed pa ma yin pa /
translated: and the nondeprivation of the speech of all tathāgatas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis @54b byams pa'i thugs dang / phan pa'i thugs dang / bdag dang / sems can thams cad thugs brtse ba nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis @54b byams pa'i thugs dang / phan pa'i thugs dang / bdag dang / sems can thams cad thugs brtse ba nye bar bzung nas /
translated: The Blessed One, with a loving mind, a helpful mind, and compassion for me and all sentient beings,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bshad du gsol /
analyzed: de bshad du gsol /
translated: please explain it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor dang / gnas gtsang ma'i gnas la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs nas dag pa'i yul la 'od rnam par spros te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor dang / gnas gtsang ma'i gnas la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs nas dag pa'i yul la 'od rnam par spros te /
translated: Then the Blessed One Śākyamuni, looking with his buddha eye at the entire assembly and the realm of the Pure Abode, emitted light into the pure realm.

original: yul rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: yul rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: He entered the samādhi called the destruction of objects.

original: bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu mdzod spu nas me tog kun tu skyes pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bskul ba zhes bya ba'i 'od phyung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu mdzod spu nas me tog kun tu skyes pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bskul ba zhes bya ba'i 'od phyung ste /
translated: As soon as the Blessed One entered samādhi, from his ūrṇā hair he emitted light called the flower that fully arises and the bodhisattva who is truly exhorted.

original: 'od bye ba khri phrag brgya stong du ma'i 'khor gyis bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su song nas /
analyzed: 'od bye ba khri phrag brgya stong du ma'i 'khor gyis bcom ldan 'das la lan gsum bskor ba byas nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su song nas /
translated: Surrounded by a retinue of many hundreds of thousands of millions of light rays, he circumambulated the Blessed One three times and then went to the trichiliocosm.

original: byang shar gyi phyogs su brgya stong gi gang g'a'i klung gi 'jig rten gyi khams 'das nas /
analyzed: byang shar gyi phyogs su brgya stong gi gang g'a'i klung gi 'jig rten gyi khams 'das nas /
translated: In the northeast, he passed through a world system of a hundred thousand Ganges Rivers.

original: me tog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams su rjes su zhugs te /
analyzed: me tog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams su rjes su zhugs te /
translated: He entered a world system called Flower Endowed.

original: gang na me tog kun tu skyes pa'i rgyal po'i dbang po zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs par ro //🔽der yang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa dang @55a *//
analyzed: gang na me tog kun tu skyes pa'i rgyal po'i dbang po zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs par ro // der yang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa dang @55a *//
translated: There he entered the presence of the thus-gone King of All-Arisen Flowers.

original: ldan pa rnams dang lhan cig gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: ldan pa rnams dang lhan cig gnas par gyur to //
translated: There, too, the youthful Mañjuśrī, by the power of his previous aspirations, dwelt together with bodhisattva mahāsattvas endowed with the conduct of bodhisattvas.

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'od zer gyi snang ba de mthong nas bzhin cung zad 'dzum pa dang ldan par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'od zer gyi snang ba de mthong nas bzhin cung zad 'dzum pa dang ldan par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs de dag la smras pa /
translated: The youthful Manjushri, having seen the radiance of that light, with a slight smile on his face, said to the assembly of bodhisattvas:

original: rgyal ba'i sras dag /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras dag /
translated: Sons of the Victorious Ones,

original: 'od 'di ni nga la yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir 'ongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'od 'di ni nga la yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir 'ongs pa yin gyi /
translated: this light has come to truly inspire me.

original: khyed cag g-yeng ba med par gyis shig ces smras so //
analyzed: khyed cag g-yeng ba med par gyis shig ces smras so //
translated: You should be undistracted.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa mig mi 'dzums shing kha bye bas 'od gang na ba de logs su mngon du bltas nas 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa mig mi 'dzums shing kha bye bas 'od gang na ba de logs su mngon du bltas nas 'dug go /
translated: Then the youthful Manjushri, the great bodhisattva, with unblinking eyes and an open face, remained looking in the direction of the light.

original: de nas bskul ba'i 'od des me tog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang ba chen pos snang bar byas te /
analyzed: de nas bskul ba'i 'od des me tog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang ba chen pos snang bar byas te /
translated: Then that inspiring light illuminated the world system called Endowed with Flowers with a great radiance.🔽The flower-born King of Power circumambulated the Tathagata three times

original: me tog kun tu skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa la lan gsum bskor ba byas te /
analyzed: me tog kun tu skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa la lan gsum bskor ba byas te /
translated: and

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i spyi bor nub par gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i spyi bor nub par gyur to //
translated: It then disappeared into the crown of the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa stan las langs te /
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta rose from his seat,

original: bcom ldan 'das me tog kun tu yang dag par skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa la lan gsum bskor ba byas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das me tog kun tu yang dag par skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa la lan gsum bskor ba byas te /
translated: circumambulated the tathāgata King of the Flowers Who Is Completely Perfect in Every Way three times,

original: spyi bos phyag btsal nas pus mo gams pa'i lhang sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: spyi bos phyag btsal nas pus mo gams pa'i lhang sa la btsugs te /
translated: bowed his head in homage, and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das me tog kun tu skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po la 'di @55b skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das me tog kun tu skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po la 'di @55b skad ces gsol to //
translated: He said to the Bhagavat King of the Flowers Who Is Completely Perfect in Every Way:

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bdag la dgongs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bdag la dgongs te /
translated: “Bhagavat, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha called Śākyamuni is thinking of me.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavat,

original: bdag ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / sngags thams cad kyi spyod pa dang / sgrub thabs dang / dkyil 'khor dang / cho ga dang / gsang ba dang / cho ga zhib mo dang /
analyzed: bdag ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / sngags thams cad kyi spyod pa dang / sgrub thabs dang / dkyil 'khor dang / cho ga dang / gsang ba dang / cho ga zhib mo dang /
translated: I wish to go from this Sahā world system to see, venerate, and serve the blessed Śākyamuni, to see Mañjuśrī, the divine youth, and to see the entire assembly of bodhisattvas, and to see the blessed buddhas who have come to this buddha field from other world systems in the ten directions, and to hear the Dharma.🔽I wish to go in order to see the conduct, practice, maṇḍala, ritual, secret, detailed ritual,

original: cho ga'i ngo bo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs dang / gsang ba dang / phyag rgya dang / dbang bskur ba bstan pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nas mchi bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: cho ga'i ngo bo dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs dang / gsang ba dang / phyag rgya dang / dbang bskur ba bstan pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nas mchi bar 'tshal lo //
translated: and the essence of the ritual of all the mantras, and in order to see the mind, secret, mudrā, and consecration of all the tathāgatas, and in order to fulfill all the wishes of all sentient beings.”

original: de skad ces bcom ldan 'das me tog kun tu skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par zhugs pa na phyogs bzhi mtha' yas mu med pa steng dang /
analyzed: de skad ces bcom ldan 'das me tog kun tu skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa la gsol pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ting nge 'dzin gang la snyoms par zhugs pa na phyogs bzhi mtha' yas mu med pa steng dang /
translated: When the Blessed One, the thus-gone King of Flowers’ Sovereign, had been thus requested, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta entered a samādhi such that the entire world system, including the Blessed One,

original: 'og dang / thad ka thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyogs sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis yang dag par gang bar gyur to //
analyzed: 'og dang / thad ka thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyogs sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis yang dag par gang bar gyur to //
translated: was filled with blessed buddhas from all directions—the four cardinal directions, the four intermediate directions, above and below—🔽and all the directions in between.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dang / bcom ldan 'das dang bcas pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dang / bcom ldan 'das dang bcas pas /
translated: The blessed buddhas in the world system, together with the Blessed One,

original: rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: said to the victor’s heir Mañjuśrī,

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: “Excellent! Excellent!

original: 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa @56a *//
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par la snyoms par zhugs pa @56a *//
translated: To enter such a distinctive samādhi

original: ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang mi nus /
analyzed: ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang mi nus /
translated: is beyond the capacity of all hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / sa bcu la gnas pa dag gis kyang snyoms par zhugs par mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / sa bcu la gnas pa dag gis kyang snyoms par zhugs par mi nus so //
translated: It is also beyond the capacity of bodhisattvas who are engaged in conduct and those who abide on the ten grounds.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das me tog kun tu yang dag par skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams dang lhan cig tu yang dag par bgros te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das me tog kun tu yang dag par skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams dang lhan cig tu yang dag par bgros te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Flower King of Complete Utter Joy, together with those Tathagata Buddha Bhagavans,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa 'di'i snying po mchog tu gsang ba don thams cad sgrub pa'i snying po gsungs pa ni yi ge gcig pa zhes bya ba mchog tu gsang ba /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa 'di'i snying po mchog tu gsang ba don thams cad sgrub pa'i snying po gsungs pa ni yi ge gcig pa zhes bya ba mchog tu gsang ba /
translated: spoke the essence of this youthful Manjushri's supreme secret, the essence that accomplishes all purposes, called the One Syllable, which is supremely secret,

original: sems can thams cad kyi las thams cad byed pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi las thams cad byed pa /
translated: performs all actions for all beings,🔽and accomplishes the excellent and special practice of mantra.

original: sngags kyi spyod pa khyad par can bzang po yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'o; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das me tog yang dag par skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa yud tsam zhig cang mi gsung bar gyur te /
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa khyad par can bzang po yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'o; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das me tog yang dag par skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de bzhin gshegs pa yud tsam zhig cang mi gsung bar gyur te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Flower King of Complete Utter Joy, remained silent for a moment,

original: thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs te /
analyzed: thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs te /
translated: looking with the Buddha eye upon the entire world.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yang dag par dgongs nas byams pa'i thugs kyis sngags gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yang dag par dgongs nas byams pa'i thugs kyis sngags gsungs so //
translated: Having considered these Blessed Buddhas, he spoke the mantra with a loving mind.

original: na ma:sarba bud dh'a n'am aam mam/
analyzed: na ma:sarba bud dh'a n'am aam mam/
translated: Namaḥ sarvabuddhabodhisattvānāṃ

original: 'di ni 'jam dpal gyi snying po mchog yin te las thams cad byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jam dpal gyi snying po mchog yin te las thams cad byed pa'o //
translated: This is the supreme essence of Mañjuśrī, which accomplishes all activities.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ting nge @56b 'dzin de las langs nas /
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ting nge @56b 'dzin de las langs nas /
translated: Then the youthful Mañjuśrī arose from that samādhi,

original: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa lag pa bskum pa las brkyang ba dang / brkyang ba las bskum pa'am /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa lag pa bskum pa las brkyang ba dang / brkyang ba las bskum pa'am /
translated: just as a powerful person would extend or retract an arm,

original: se gol gtogs pa tsam mam /
analyzed: se gol gtogs pa tsam mam /
translated: or snap one's fingers,🔽or open and close one's eyes.

original: mig 'byed 'dzums tsam la rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyi shugs blo ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnam par 'phrul pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: mig 'byed 'dzums tsam la rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyi shugs blo ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnam par 'phrul pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: He entered the special samādhi called the power of miraculous strength and the manifestation of the samādhi called 'speed'.

original: mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su chas te sngar 'khod nas /
analyzed: mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su chas te sngar 'khod nas /
translated: He went to the Sahā world realm and arrived first.

original: steng gi nam mkha'i dkyil na nor bu rin po che rab tu gnas pa'i gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams gnas su 'dug ste /

analyzed: rig pa dang / zhabs su ldan pa / bde bar gshegs pa / 'jig rten mkhyen pa / @59b skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba / lha dang / mi rnams kyi ston pa de chos ston te /
translated: In the world system called Endowed with Flowers, the blessed one, the thus-gone, the worthy one, the perfect buddha, the one with proper knowledge and conduct, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the charioteer who tames beings, the unexcelled, the teacher of gods and humans, the blessed buddha Flower Perfectly Born Lord of the Senses,🔽teaches the Dharma.

original: thog mar dge ba /🔽bar du dge ba /

original: tha mar dge ba /🔽don bzang po /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba / don bzang po /

original: tshig 'bru bzang po /
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po /

original: ma 'dres pa; yongs su rdzogs pa /🔽yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa; yongs su rdzogs pa / yongs su dag pa /
translated: It is unadulterated, complete,🔽pure,

original: yongs su dkar ba /
analyzed: yongs su dkar ba /

original: tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par ston to //

original: de da ltar bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston to //
analyzed: de da ltar bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes la chos kyang ston to //

original: sngags kyi spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang / lam gsum gyi spyod pa'i lam sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang / lam gsum gyi spyod pa'i lam sgrub par byed pa /

original: skyob pa dang / gnas dang / skyabs dang / dpung gnyen dang / bde ba dang; shin tu mthar thug pa dang / shin tu yongs su mthar phyin par byed pa sems can rnams la ston te /
analyzed: skyob pa dang / gnas dang / skyabs dang / dpung gnyen dang / bde ba dang; shin tu mthar thug pa dang / shin tu yongs su mthar phyin par byed pa sems can rnams la ston te /

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyis rjes su gnang nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung 'dir mchis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyis rjes su gnang nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs drung 'dir mchis so //
translated: Having been authorized by that very Blessed One, I have come into the presence of the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das me tog yang dag par skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de yang bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa nyung ngam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das me tog yang dag par skyes pa rgyal po'i dbang po de yang bcom ldan 'das la gnod pa nyung ngam /
translated: The Blessed One, the King of Flowers Who Has Fully Attained, asks the Blessed One if he has few troubles,

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /

original: bde ba la reg par gnas sam zhes 'dri'o //
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas sam zhes 'dri'o //

original: 'di skad kyang gsung ste /
analyzed: 'di skad kyang gsung ste /

analyzed: gang du 'di lta bu'i snyigs ma lnga'i dus su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa 'byung ba ni ngo mtshar to zhes so //

original: de yang lam gsum dang / byang grol dang / mir skye ba thob pa nyid kyi chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: de yang lam gsum dang / byang grol dang / mir skye ba thob pa nyid kyi chos ston par byed do //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are on the three paths, to those who are liberated, and to those who have obtained birth as a human.🔽He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three realms, to those who are in the three worlds, and to those who are in the three existences.🔽He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three times, to those who are in the three vehicles, and to those who are in the three yānas.

analyzed: gang du sems can gyi ris skal ba med pa dang / srid pa gsum yang @60a *//
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three existences, to those who are in the three realms, and to those who are in the three worlds.🔽He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three times, to those who are in the three vehicles, and to those who are in the three yānas.🔽He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three existences, to those who are in the three realms, and to those who are in the three worlds.🔽He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three times, to those who are in the three vehicles, and to those who are in the three yānas.🔽He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three existences, to those who are in the three realms, and to those who are in the three worlds.

original: dag par 'joms par byed pa'i lam dang / gtan du grub pa dang / bde ba dang / mthun pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la sems can rnams 'god par byed pa'i bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i brtson 'grus ni ngo mtshar to //🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: dag par 'joms par byed pa'i lam dang / gtan du grub pa dang / bde ba dang / mthun pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la sems can rnams 'god par byed pa'i bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i brtson 'grus ni ngo mtshar to // bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three times, to those who are in the three vehicles, and to those who are in the three yānas.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab bo //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs ni /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab bo // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs ni /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three existences, to those who are in the three realms, and to those who are in the three worlds.🔽He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three times, to those who are in the three vehicles, and to those who are in the three yānas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen par 'gyur gyi /🔽bdag gis ci zhig 'tshal ba rngo thogs /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis mkhyen par 'gyur gyi / bdag gis ci zhig 'tshal ba rngo thogs /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three existences, to those who are in the three realms, and to those who are in the three worlds.🔽He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three times, to those who are in the three vehicles, and to those who are in the three yānas.🔽He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three existences, to those who are in the three realms, and to those who are in the three worlds.

original: dbang phyug gis rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: dbang phyug gis rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who are in the three times, to those who are in the three vehicles, and to those who are in the three yānas

original: rmad du byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa shes par gyur ram /🔽'tshal bar ram /
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa shes par gyur ram / 'tshal bar ram /

analyzed: thugs kyi spyad pa spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i sgrub pa dang / spyod pa 'tshal bar ram /
translated: Do you know the practice and conduct that follows the practice of the mind?

original: mdor na / bskal pa bye ba khri phrag brgya stong gi bar du 'ang bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: mdor na / bskal pa bye ba khri phrag brgya stong gi bar du 'ang bstan par mi nus so //
translated: In short, it is not possible to teach it even in a hundred thousand quintillion eons.

original: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa bsdus pa'am /
translated: The Tathāgata’s activity, which is included in the tathāgatas,

analyzed: tha dad ma lus pa'i ngo bo 'di ni chos 'dus ma byas su blta bar bya ste /

analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba la brten pa 'am /

analyzed: yon tan ni; bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa kho nas mkhyen pa yin gyi /

analyzed: bdag gis ni ma lags so //
translated: but I do not.”

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la /

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

original: khyod legs par 'ongs sam /
analyzed: khyod legs par 'ongs sam /

analyzed: sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs pa bsgrub pas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi don thob par byed pa /

original: sngags thams cad kyi tshig dang / gsang ba dang bcas pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor dang / cho ga dang / dbang bskur ba dang / tshe dang / nad med pa dang / dbang phyug dang / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: sngags thams cad kyi tshig dang / gsang ba dang bcas pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / phyag rgya dang / dkyil 'khor dang / cho ga dang / dbang bskur ba dang / tshe dang / nad med pa dang / dbang phyug dang / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: It accomplishes the words of all mantras, the secret initiations, the mudras, the mandalas, the rituals, the initiations, longevity, health, power, and the complete fulfillment of all wishes.

original: sgrub pa'i thabs thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i thabs thams cad dang ldan pa /

original: rgyud shes pa dang / shes bya dang / dus dang / mi snang ba dang / rgyal po'i zhing du gyur pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba shes @61a *//🔽par byed pa /
analyzed: rgyud shes pa dang / shes bya dang / dus dang / mi snang ba dang / rgyal po'i zhing du gyur pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba shes @61a *// par byed pa /

analyzed: mdor na sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: It causes the complete fulfillment of all the wishes of all sentient beings.🔽In brief, it causes the complete fulfillment of all the wishes of all sentient beings.

analyzed: rang gi yon tan dang / mthun pa'i sngags kyi spyod pa rjes su 'jug pa /

original: sems can gzhan dga' bar byed pa /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dga' bar byed pa /

original: mi snang bar 'gro ba /
analyzed: mi snang bar 'gro ba /

original: nam mkha' la 'gro ba /
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro ba /
translated: The going in the sky.

original: chu la mi nub par 'gro ba /🔽yid gzhungs par byed pa /
analyzed: chu la mi nub par 'gro ba / yid gzhungs par byed pa /

original: 'gugs par byed pa /
analyzed: 'gugs par byed pa /
translated: The summoning.

original: sa 'og tu 'jug pa /
analyzed: sa 'og tu 'jug pa /
translated: The entering into the underworld.

original: mngon du spyod par byed pa /
analyzed: mngon du spyod par byed pa /
translated: The manifest conduct.

original: 'dod pa thams cad thob par byed pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad thob par byed pa /
translated: The attainment of all desires.

analyzed: gnod sbyin dang / gnod sbyin mo thams cad dang / mngag gzhug pa dang / sha za dang / 'byung po thams cad 'gugs par byed pa /

original: byis pa dang / rgan po dang / gzhon nu gnas ji lta ba bzhin 'jog par byed pa /
analyzed: byis pa dang / rgan po dang / gzhon nu gnas ji lta ba bzhin 'jog par byed pa /

original: mdor na las thams cad byed pa ste /
analyzed: mdor na las thams cad byed pa ste /

original: yid la re ba thams cad rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: yid la re ba thams cad rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: The fulfillment of all wishes.

original: mngon spyod dang / rgyas pa dang / zhi ba'i las dag rab tu byed pa /
analyzed: mngon spyod dang / rgyas pa dang / zhi ba'i las dag rab tu byed pa /
translated: The performance of the activities of violence, increase, and pacification.

original: ji lta ji ltar rab tu sbyar ba de lta de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod phal po che bskal pa chen po'i rin po che'i le'u rab 'byams 'di ngas kyang rjes su gnang zhing sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang gsungs te /

translated: The more it is applied, the more I, the Buddha, will also give my approval to this great treasure of the Bodhisattva canon, this great eon of the precious chapter, and it will be taught by all the buddhas.

original: sems can dag pa'i rang gi sngags spyod pa'i don gyi chos kyi mdzod /
analyzed: sems can dag pa'i rang gi sngags spyod pa'i don gyi chos kyi mdzod /
translated: It is the treasure of the Dharma that is the meaning of the mantra conduct of pure beings.

analyzed: skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / lha dang / mi rnams dang / sems can thams cad kyi don du @61b stan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the benefit of many beings, for the happiness of many beings, for the sake of the gods, humans, and all beings, and for the teacher.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'od kyi snang ba bkod pa'i rgyan yang dag par bskul ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu dag pa'i sems can gyi

translated: Then, the youthful Mañjuśrī, immediately upon entering the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas called “the ornament of the array of the light of the blessings of all the buddhas,”

translated: The light pervaded as many world systems as there are grains of sand in the Ganges, up to the Akaniṣṭha realm and down to the Avīci hell.

analyzed: sems can gang su dag shin tu sdug bsngal ba de dag thams cad kyi sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar gyur to //

analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yang dag par bskul nas /
translated: Having roused all the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and blessed buddhas,

analyzed: 'od de yang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i spyi bo'i gtsug tu nub par gyur to //
translated: that light disappeared into the crown of the head of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: 'dir gang dag shar phyogs na rnam par gnas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der 'od zer rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi reg pa'i bya bas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yang dag par bskul te /

analyzed: sha za mo chen mo 'di dag sha za mo'i 'khor bye ba brgya stong phrag du ma dang bcas pa de dag kyang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po der 'dus shing rab tu zhugs par gyur to //
translated: These great flesh-eating demonesses, together with their retinues of many hundreds of thousands of millions of flesh-eating demonesses, gathered in that great maṇḍala of the retinue and entered.

original: gang yang ma mo dang / ma mo chen mo dag 'jig rten gyi rjes su rnam par spyod cing sems can rnams la 'tshe bar byed cing gtor ma dang / me tog dman pa la spyod par byed pa dag la /
analyzed: gang yang ma mo dang / ma mo chen mo dag 'jig rten gyi rjes su rnam par spyod cing sems can rnams la 'tshe bar byed cing gtor ma dang / me tog dman pa la spyod par byed pa dag la /
translated: There were also the mātṛkā and great mātṛkā who, following the ways of the world, harm sentient beings and enjoy inferior offerings and flowers.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They were as follows:

original: tshangs pa ma dang / dbang phyug chen po ma dang / khyab 'jug ma dang / gzhon nu ma dang / rgan byad ma dang / phag mo dang / dbang mo dang / gshin rje mo dang / me phyogs ma dang / nyi ma'i bu mo dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa ma dang / dbang phyug chen po ma dang / khyab 'jug ma dang / gzhon nu ma dang / rgan byad ma dang / phag mo dang / dbang mo dang / gshin rje mo dang / me phyogs ma dang / nyi ma'i bu mo dang /
translated: the mātṛkā of Brahmā, the mātṛkā of Maheśvara, the mātṛkā of Viṣṇu, the mātṛkā of Kumāra, the mātṛkā of Vṛddhi, the mātṛkā of Vārāhī, the mātṛkā of Vāyu, the mātṛkā of Yama, the mātṛkā of Agni, and the mātṛkā of Sūrya’s son.

original: 'jig rten mthar byed ma dang / chu lha ma dang / dbang ldan ma dang / rlung phyogs ma dang / gzhan gyi srog 'phrog ma dang / mgo @83a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten mthar byed ma dang / chu lha ma dang / dbang ldan ma dang / rlung phyogs ma dang / gzhan gyi srog 'phrog ma dang / mgo @83a *//
translated: the world-destroyer, the water-spirit, the powerful one, the wind-quarter, the life-stealer, the shaven-headed,

original: bregs ma dang / bya ma dang / bya ma chen mo dang / srul mo dang / lus srul mo dang / skem byed ma ste /
analyzed: bregs ma dang / bya ma dang / bya ma chen mo dang / srul mo dang / lus srul mo dang / skem byed ma ste /
translated: the bird, the great bird, the female goblin, the female goblin of the body, and the emaciated one.

original: ma mo chen mo de dag kyang ma mo'i 'khor bye ba khri phrag brgya stong du ma dang bcas pa de dag kyang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po der sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'don cing 'khod par gyur to //
analyzed: ma mo chen mo de dag kyang ma mo'i 'khor bye ba khri phrag brgya stong du ma dang bcas pa de dag kyang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po der sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'don cing 'khod par gyur to //
translated: These great mothers, together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of retinues of mothers, were also present in that great circle of the retinue, uttering the words “Homage to the Buddha.”

original: de bzhin du mi dang / mi ma yin pa bye ba khri phrag brgya stong du ma dang / sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa nas dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du thams cad kyang skabs 'dir nam mkha'i dkyil du snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi dang / mi ma yin pa bye ba khri phrag brgya stong du ma dang / sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa nas dmyal ba chen po mnar med pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du thams cad kyang skabs 'dir nam mkha'i dkyil du snang bar gyur to //
translated: In the same way, many hundreds of thousands of millions of humans and non-humans, sentient beings and non-sentient beings, from the great hell of Avīci up to the peak of existence, all appeared in the center of the sky at this time.

original: sems can gyi ris na srog chags su la yang phan tshun mi mthun pa med par gyur to //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris na srog chags su la yang phan tshun mi mthun pa med par gyur to //
translated: In the realm of sentient beings, there was no living being whatsoever who was not in harmony with each other.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul gyi rgyan gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa sems can thams cad kyi spyi bo'i gtsug na bzhugs par mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis brlabs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul gyi rgyan gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa sems can thams cad kyi spyi bo'i gtsug na bzhugs par mthong bar gyur to //
translated: By the blessing of the Buddha and the magical display of the bodhisattvas, all sentient beings saw the blessed Buddha and Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta seated on the crown of their heads.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par gzigs nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par gzigs nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One Śākyamuni, having surveyed the entire world with his buddha eye, said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta:

original: dag pa'i sems dpa'/
analyzed: dag pa'i sems dpa'/
translated: “Pure Being,

original: sngags kyi spyod pa'i don @83b rnam par gtan la dbab pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u rab 'byams byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod gang 'di bshad pa'i dus la bab par sems na shod cig /
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa'i don @83b rnam par gtan la dbab pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u rab 'byams byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod gang 'di bshad pa'i dus la bab par sems na shod cig /
translated: if you think that the time has come to explain the bodhisattva canon, the extensive chapter on meditative concentration, the ascertainment of the meaning of mantra conduct, then speak.”

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas rjes su gnang bar mdzad pa na /
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas rjes su gnang bar mdzad pa na /
translated: Then, when Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta was authorized by the Blessed One, the Śākya Sage,

original: nam mkha'i ngo bo dang 'dra ba'i rdo rje mthug cing sra ba'i rgyud bkod pa'i rgyan zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i ngo bo dang 'dra ba'i rdo rje mthug cing sra ba'i rgyud bkod pa'i rgyan zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: he entered the meditative absorption called “the array of the ornament of the continuum of the vajra that is thick and solid, which is like the nature of space.”

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa de snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu gnas gtsang ma'i gzhal med khang de dpag ched brgya stong du ma rgya che ba'i rdo rje'i rang bzhin du lhag par gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa de snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu gnas gtsang ma'i gzhal med khang de dpag ched brgya stong du ma rgya che ba'i rdo rje'i rang bzhin du lhag par gnas par gyur to //
translated: As soon as Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta entered that meditative absorption, the palace of the Pure Abodes became a vajra nature that was vast and extended over many hundreds of thousands of leagues.

original: gang du gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / dri za dang / rlung lha dang / sha za de dag dang / mdor na /
analyzed: gang du gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / dri za dang / rlung lha dang / sha za de dag dang / mdor na /
translated: Wherever the yakṣas, rākṣasas, gandharvas, mārutas, and piśācas were,

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis gzhal med khang de dag rdo rje nor bu rin po che lta bur gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis gzhal med khang de dag rdo rje nor bu rin po che lta bur gyur te /
translated: in short, throughout the entire realm of sentient beings, the palace became a vajra jewel through the blessing of the bodhisattvas.

original: der rab tu zhugs nas 'khod par gyur kyang phan tshun rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa med do //
analyzed: der rab tu zhugs nas 'khod par gyur kyang phan tshun rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa med do //
translated: Even though they have entered and are seated there, they do not harm each other.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po de 'dus par gyur par shes nas khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje'i gshed la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po de 'dus par gyur par shes nas khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje'i gshed la smras pa /
translated: Then Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, knowing that the great assembly of the maṇḍala had gathered, said to Yamāri, the king of wrathful ones:

original: kye khro bo chen po /🔽sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis rjes su nges par 'byung bar byed pa 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po 'dus pa @84a *//
analyzed: kye khro bo chen po / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis rjes su nges par 'byung bar byed pa 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po 'dus pa @84a *//
translated: “O Great Wrathful One,🔽all the buddhas and bodhisattvas have given their consent.

original: 'di'i sems can thams cad srungs shig srungs shig /
analyzed: 'di'i sems can thams cad srungs shig srungs shig /
translated: Protect, protect all the sentient beings in this great assembly of the maṇḍala!

original: dbang du gyis shig /
analyzed: dbang du gyis shig /
translated: Bring them under control!

original: ma rungs pa gdul bar gyis shig /
analyzed: ma rungs pa gdul bar gyis shig /
translated: Subdue the unruly ones!

original: sems can zhi ba dag sad par gyis shig /
analyzed: sems can zhi ba dag sad par gyis shig /
translated: Awaken the sentient beings who are at peace!

original: sems can thams cad dad par gyis shig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dad par gyis shig /
translated: Inspire faith in all sentient beings!

original: ji srid du nga'i rang gi sngags kyi spyod pa rjes su sgrub pa /
analyzed: ji srid du nga'i rang gi sngags kyi spyod pa rjes su sgrub pa /
translated: As long as they practice my own mantra conduct,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod rgya che ba dag las sngags spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga 'chad par byed pa de srid kyi bar du 'di dag gi phyi rol tu sang la srung ba gyis shig /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod rgya che ba dag las sngags spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga 'chad par byed pa de srid kyi bar du 'di dag gi phyi rol tu sang la srung ba gyis shig /
translated: Until the explanation of the maṇḍala rituals of the mantra conduct from the vast piṭaka of the bodhisattvas, you must guard the perimeter of this place.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / khro bo'i rgyal pos bka' mnyan nas /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / khro bo'i rgyal pos bka' mnyan nas /
translated: When this was said, the king of wrathful ones listened to the command

original: khro bo chen po'i gzugs kyis sems can thams cad rjes su bsrung ba dang / rjes su bstan pa'i phyir 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje gshed khro bo'i 'khor brgya stong phrag du ma phyogs bzhi kun dang / steng dang /
analyzed: khro bo chen po'i gzugs kyis sems can thams cad rjes su bsrung ba dang / rjes su bstan pa'i phyir 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje gshed khro bo'i 'khor brgya stong phrag du ma phyogs bzhi kun dang / steng dang /
translated: and, in the form of a great wrathful one, in order to protect and instruct all sentient beings, the wrathful king Yamāntaka and his retinue of many hundreds of thousands of wrathful ones were in all the maṇḍalas of the retinue, in the four directions above,

original: 'og dang / thad ka dag tu shin tu mi bzad pa'i sgra rab tu 'don cing gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: 'og dang / thad ka dag tu shin tu mi bzad pa'i sgra rab tu 'don cing gnas par gyur to //
translated: below, and in the intermediate directions, and they remained there, emitting extremely terrifying sounds.

original: de nas sems can de dag zhi ba dang / yid dang / sems bzang po dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag zhi ba dang / yid dang / sems bzang po dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: Then those sentient beings became peaceful, and their minds and thoughts became good.

original: bka' las mi 'da' bar byed par gyur to //
analyzed: bka' las mi 'da' bar byed par gyur to //
translated: They became obedient to the command.

original: 'di lta bu'i sgra yang thos par gyur te gang dam tshig 'di las 'da' par byed pa de dag ni aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du mgo tshal pa brgyar 'gas par 'gyur to /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sgra yang thos par gyur te gang dam tshig 'di las 'da' par byed pa de dag ni aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du mgo tshal pa brgyar 'gas par 'gyur to /
translated: And this sound was heard: “Those who transgress this pledge will have their heads split into a hundred pieces, like the fruit of the arjaka plant.🔽This is also the bodhisattva’s consecration.”

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyang de yin @84b no; ;de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas rang gi sngags kyi spyod pa'i don du chos kyi tshig smras pa /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyang de yin @84b no; ;de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas rang gi sngags kyi spyod pa'i don du chos kyi tshig smras pa /
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, for the sake of the practice of his mantra, spoke these words on the Dharma:

original: chos gcig la yang dag par bsams na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos gcig la yang dag par bsams na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: “When a bodhisattva mahāsattva correctly contemplates a single Dharma, his mantra will be accomplished.

original: gcig po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gcig po gang zhe na /
translated: What is that one?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i rnam par rjes su mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i rnam par rjes su mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing all phenomena as free from conceptual elaboration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gnyis la rab tu gnas na sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gnyis la rab tu gnas na sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: When a bodhisattva mahāsattva abides in two Dharmas, his mantra will be accomplished.

original: gnyis po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba nyid dang / sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems mi gtong ba nyid dang / sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa'o //
translated: having an attitude of equality toward all sentient beings.

original: chos gsum dang ldan na sngags kyi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos gsum dang ldan na sngags kyi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: “If one possesses three qualities, one will perfect the practice of mantra.

original: gsum po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?🔽Not abandoning any sentient being,🔽upholding the bodhisattva vow of ethical discipline, and

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa srung ba dang / rang gi sngags yongs su mi gtong ba nyid do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa srung ba dang / rang gi sngags yongs su mi gtong ba nyid do //
translated: not abandoning one’s own mantra.

original: chos bzhi dang yang dag par ldan na dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos bzhi dang yang dag par ldan na dang po sems bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sngags 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: “If one possesses four qualities, the mantra of a bodhisattva who has generated the initial thought of awakening will be successful.

original: bzhi po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?🔽Not abandoning one’s own mantra,🔽not interfering with the mantras of others,🔽dwelling in love for all sentient beings, and

original: rang gi sngags yongs su mi gtong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi sngags rjes su gcod pa med pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad la byams pas gnas pa nyid dang / snying rje chen pos yongs su bsgos pa'i sems pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi sngags yongs su mi gtong pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi sngags rjes su gcod pa med pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad la byams pas gnas pa nyid dang / snying rje chen pos yongs su bsgos pa'i sems pa nyid do //
translated: having a mind suffused with great compassion.

original: chos bzhi po 'di dag dang ldan na dang po sems bskyed @85a *//
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di dag dang ldan na dang po sems bskyed @85a *//
translated: If you have these four qualities, you will be able to generate the awakening mind.🔽

original: pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sngags 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sngags 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one possesses these four qualities, the mantra of the bodhisattva who has generated the mind of awakening for the first time will be accomplished.

original: chos lnga dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la 'jug cing sngags kyi spyod pa sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos lnga dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod la 'jug cing sngags kyi spyod pa sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one possesses five qualities, one will enter the Bodhisattva Canon and accomplish the practice of mantra.

original: lnga po gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?🔽Relying on a solitary place,🔽dwelling in a remote wilderness,🔽being free from anger towards other beings,

original: rnam par dben pa'i phyogs yang dag par bsten pa nyid dang / bas mtha' dgon pa sten par byed pa nyid dang / sems can gzhan la zhe sdang med pa nyid dang / 'jig rten pa'i sngags la mi lta ba nyid dang / tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: rnam par dben pa'i phyogs yang dag par bsten pa nyid dang / bas mtha' dgon pa sten par byed pa nyid dang / sems can gzhan la zhe sdang med pa nyid dang / 'jig rten pa'i sngags la mi lta ba nyid dang / tshul khrims dang /
translated: not relying on worldly mantras,

original: thos pa dang / spyod pa la gnas par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: thos pa dang / spyod pa la gnas par byed pa nyid de /
translated: and abiding in discipline, learning, and conduct.

original: chos lnga po 'di dag dang ldan na sngags spyod pa'i don 'grub cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos lnga po 'di dag dang ldan na sngags spyod pa'i don 'grub cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one possesses these five qualities, the purpose of mantra practice will be accomplished and perfected.

original: chos drug dang ldan na sngags kyi spyod pa 'grub cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos drug dang ldan na sngags kyi spyod pa 'grub cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: “If one possesses six qualities, one’s practice of mantra will be accomplished and perfected.

original: drug po gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: dkon mchog gsum la dad pa rjes su mi gcod pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' la dang ba rjes su mi gcod pa nyid dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags la kun tu dga' ba nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings spros pa med pa la lta ba nyid dang /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la dad pa rjes su mi gcod pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' la dang ba rjes su mi gcod pa nyid dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sngags la kun tu dga' ba nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings spros pa med pa la lta ba nyid dang /
translated: They are: not interrupting one’s faith in the Three Jewels, not interrupting one’s faith in the bodhisattvas, delighting in worldly and transcendent mantras, viewing the unelaborated expanse of reality,🔽not abandoning the profound words and meanings of the Mahāyāna sūtras and having an undistracted mind,

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde zab mo'i tshig gi don mi spong zhing skyo ba med pa'i sems nyid dang / sngags kyi spyod pa yongs su btsal ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs yongs su mi gtong ba nyid de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde zab mo'i tshig gi don mi spong zhing skyo ba med pa'i sems nyid dang / sngags kyi spyod pa yongs su btsal ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs yongs su mi gtong ba nyid de /
translated: and not abandoning the pursuit of the practice of mantra and the side of virtue.

original: chos drug po 'di dag dang ldan na @85b rig pa'i spyod pa dang / sngags 'grub cing yang dag par sgrub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos drug po 'di dag dang ldan na @85b rig pa'i spyod pa dang / sngags 'grub cing yang dag par sgrub pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one possesses these six qualities, one’s practice of mantra will be accomplished and perfected.”

original: chos bdun dang ldan na rig pa sgrub pa'i dus kyi thabs thob par 'gyur zhing sngags kyi spyod pa la rjes su spyod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos bdun dang ldan na rig pa sgrub pa'i dus kyi thabs thob par 'gyur zhing sngags kyi spyod pa la rjes su spyod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If one has seven qualities, one obtains the method of the time of accomplishing knowledge and one becomes one who practices the conduct of mantra.

original: bdun po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: theg pa zab mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid sgom pa dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / 'don du 'jug pa dang / 'dri ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mos pa nyid dang / dus dang /
analyzed: theg pa zab mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid sgom pa dang / klog pa dang / ston pa dang / 'don du 'jug pa dang / 'dri ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la mos pa nyid dang / dus dang /
translated: They are: meditating on the profound vehicle, the perfection of wisdom itself; reading it, teaching it, having it recited, copying it, and being devoted to the conduct of the bodhisattvas;🔽being devoted to time,🔽direction, restraint, recitation, burnt offerings, silence, and austerities;

original: phyogs dang / nges par sdom pa dang / bzlas pa dang / sbyin sreg dang / mi smra ba dang / dka' thub la gzhol ba nyid dang / rtogs pa dang / blo dang / dran pa dang / shes rab dang / bstan pa la bsnyen pa nyid dang /
analyzed: phyogs dang / nges par sdom pa dang / bzlas pa dang / sbyin sreg dang / mi smra ba dang / dka' thub la gzhol ba nyid dang / rtogs pa dang / blo dang / dran pa dang / shes rab dang / bstan pa la bsnyen pa nyid dang /
translated: and being devoted to realization, intelligence, memory, wisdom, and the teachings.

original: byang chub kyi tshogs dang / theg pa chen po dang / zab pa'i chos kyi tshul la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa nyid dang / rang dga'i sngags dgug pa'i bya ba la mkhas pa nyid dang / snying rje chen po dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs dang / theg pa chen po dang / zab pa'i chos kyi tshul la yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa nyid dang / rang dga'i sngags dgug pa'i bya ba la mkhas pa nyid dang / snying rje chen po dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: the accumulation of enlightenment, the Great Vehicle, the correct entry into the way of the profound Dharma, skill in the activity of summoning the mantra of one’s choice, great compassion, great love,

original: btang snyoms chen po dang / dga' ba chen po nyid yongs su bsgom pa nyid dang / spros pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid la 'jug pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su 'tshol ba nyid dang /
analyzed: btang snyoms chen po dang / dga' ba chen po nyid yongs su bsgom pa nyid dang / spros pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi dbyings kyi de bzhin nyid la 'jug pa gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su 'tshol ba nyid dang /
translated: great equanimity, and great joy; the cultivation of the nonconceptual realm of sentient beings, the nondual nature that enters into the suchness of space, the pursuit of the wisdom of omniscience;

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba nyid dang / theg pa dman pa la dga' ba med @86a *//🔽pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba nyid dang / theg pa dman pa la dga' ba med @86a *// pa nyid de /
translated: never abandoning any sentient being; and never delighting in the Lesser Vehicle.

original: chos bdun po de dag gis ni rig pa dang / sngags 'grub cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos bdun po de dag gis ni rig pa dang / sngags 'grub cing yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these seven qualities, knowledge and mantra will be accomplished and perfected.

original: chos brgyad dang ldan na rig pa dang / sngags kyi spyod pa'i don 'grub cing lam du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos brgyad dang ldan na rig pa dang / sngags kyi spyod pa'i don 'grub cing lam du 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one has the eight qualities, one will accomplish the meaning of the conduct of knowledge and mantra and will proceed on the path.

original: brgyad po gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?🔽Not looking at the results of seeing and not seeing,🔽having the desire to think,

original: mthong ba dang / ma mthong pa'i 'bras bu dag la blta ba dang / sems par 'dod pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa nyid la the tshom med cing dang pa nyid dang /
analyzed: mthong ba dang / ma mthong pa'i 'bras bu dag la blta ba dang / sems par 'dod pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa nyid la the tshom med cing dang pa nyid dang /
translated: not having doubt and having faith in the miracles and emanations of the bodhisattvas,🔽holding the mantra without error,🔽having respect for the guru,

original: phyin ci ma ldog pa'i sngags gzung ba dang / bla ma la gus pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi sngags dang / rgyud dang / spyod pa bstan pa mi slu ba bzung zhing bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba nyid dang /
analyzed: phyin ci ma ldog pa'i sngags gzung ba dang / bla ma la gus pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyi sngags dang / rgyud dang / spyod pa bstan pa mi slu ba bzung zhing bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba nyid dang /
translated: holding the mantra, tantra, and conduct taught by the buddhas and bodhisattvas as undeceiving, and giving away all possessions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa rmi lam na mthong ba rab tu ston pa la mkhas pa nyid dang / ser sna dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa mtha' dag dang bral bar byed cing rtag tu brtson 'grus rtsom la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gnas dang / gnas ma yin pa rmi lam na mthong ba rab tu ston pa la mkhas pa nyid dang / ser sna dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa mtha' dag dang bral bar byed cing rtag tu brtson 'grus rtsom la /
translated: It is to be free from all miserliness, sleep, and dullness, and to always be diligent.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la bdag nyid 'bul bar byed pa nyid dang / mdor bsdu na dge ba'i rtsa bas cho ga mi shes shing go cha chen po bgos pa dang / bgegs thams cad rab tu sel bar 'dod pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la bdag nyid 'bul bar byed pa nyid dang / mdor bsdu na dge ba'i rtsa bas cho ga mi shes shing go cha chen po bgos pa dang / bgegs thams cad rab tu sel bar 'dod pa nyid dang /
translated: It is to offer oneself to the buddhas and bodhisattvas. In brief, it is to be without the knowledge of the rite of the roots of virtue, to don the great armor, and to wish to dispel all obstacles.

original: byang chub kyi snying po gnon ba dang / longs @86b spyod chen po dang / dbang che bar grags par bdag nyid 'dod pa nyid dang / dbang che bar grags pa'i gang zag la bsnyen pa dang / dge ba'i bshes dang mi 'bral bar bya ba dang; byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la nye bar gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po gnon ba dang / longs @86b spyod chen po dang / dbang che bar grags par bdag nyid 'dod pa nyid dang / dbang che bar grags pa'i gang zag la bsnyen pa dang / dge ba'i bshes dang mi 'bral bar bya ba dang; byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la nye bar gnas pa nyid de /
translated: to approach the site of enlightenment, to have great wealth, to be renowned for one’s greatness, to be devoted to those who are renowned for their greatness, to never be separated from the spiritual friend, and to be in the presence of the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.

original: chos brgyad po 'di dag dang ldan na sngags spyod pa'i don 'grub pa'i yang dag pa'i lam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos brgyad po 'di dag dang ldan na sngags spyod pa'i don 'grub pa'i yang dag pa'i lam du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one possesses these eight qualities, one will be on the right path to accomplishing the aims of mantra practice.

original: grogs po dag mdor na /
analyzed: grogs po dag mdor na /
translated: “Friends, in brief,

original: byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la dad pa dang / mchog tu sdug bsngal zhing tshul khrims nyams pa la yang mi skyo ba'i yid kyis rtag tu mngon par brtson pa la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la dad pa dang / mchog tu sdug bsngal zhing tshul khrims nyams pa la yang mi skyo ba'i yid kyis rtag tu mngon par brtson pa la /
translated: one should never be separated from the mind of awakening, have faith in the Three Jewels, and always be diligent with a mind that is never discouraged, even when suffering greatly and one’s discipline is impaired.

original: nga'i sngags kyi le'u rab 'byams mtha' yas shing rmad du byung ba byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i yid las byung ba 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nga'i sngags kyi le'u rab 'byams mtha' yas shing rmad du byung ba byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i yid las byung ba 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The infinite and marvelous chapters on mantra, which are the mental creation that is in accord with the cause of the bodhisattva conduct, will be accomplished.

original: de las gzhan du shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan du shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be known otherwise.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid du byas nas nyam sad pa'i phyir yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i yid du byas nas nyam sad pa'i phyir yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //

analyzed: de nas thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi byin gyis brlabs pa dag gis 'di skad du tshig brjod par byed de /
translated: Then the entire retinue, blessed by the buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, and noble śrāvakas, uttered these words:

analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King!🔽Whoever reads this chapter on the assembly,

analyzed: 'phags pa'i dkyil 'khor bzang po de grub pa'i gnas skabs la gnas pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas gzigs nas /

analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras /

analyzed: zla ba phyed kyi bar du gcig pu rab tu gnas par bya ste /

analyzed: chung ngu ni khru brgyad pa'o //

analyzed: 'bring ni longs spyod 'phel byed pa //

original: las rnams kun byed zhi ba yin //
analyzed: las rnams kun byed zhi ba yin //

analyzed: 'tshe ba med par 'gyur ro //

translated: On the peak of a mountain, on the bank of a river, on the shore of the ocean, or on the bank of a great river, one should carefully and thoroughly examine a great heap of sand.

analyzed: shin tu gtsang ba dang / srog chags med par byas la bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i skud pa la khro bo'i snying po lan bdun bzlas pa byas te /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor phyogs bzhi kun nas bskor bar bya'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du dbus kyi gnas su nang du yang zur bzhir bya'o //

analyzed: dbus na gnas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis rang gi rig pa rtsa ba'i sngags stong rtsa brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
translated: The maṇḍala master who is in the middle should recite his root mantra one thousand and eight times.

translated: Having formed the great five-crested mudrā, he should protect his friend and himself with the root mantra, and while reciting the mantra he should come out of the maṇḍala.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor de'i gru bzhi kun tu ku shas bskor zhing dgram par bya'o //
