analyzed: de nyid kyi phyi rol tu yang pa rnams zhag gcig gnas pas bsnyal zhing dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Outside of that, the ashes should be placed for one day and then removed.

original: de la dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis sngon du bya ba rnams byas nas rang gi rgyud kyi sngags la mkha' @101a *//
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis sngon du bya ba rnams byas nas rang gi rgyud kyi sngags la mkha' @101a *//
translated: There, the maṇḍala master, having performed the preliminary practices, should recite the mantra of his tantra,

original: pa dang / sems can gyi don gyi thabs kyi phyir theg pa chen po la mos pa dang / zhag gcig smyung bar byas pa dang / grogs bzang po dang ldan pa dang; bstan bcos sna tshogs kyi las mthong bas tshon sna lnga'i phye ma zhib mo shin tu gsal zhing legs par sbyar ba byas la /
analyzed: pa dang / sems can gyi don gyi thabs kyi phyir theg pa chen po la mos pa dang / zhag gcig smyung bar byas pa dang / grogs bzang po dang ldan pa dang; bstan bcos sna tshogs kyi las mthong bas tshon sna lnga'i phye ma zhib mo shin tu gsal zhing legs par sbyar ba byas la /
translated: and for the sake of the welfare of beings, he should have faith in the Mahāyāna, fast for one day, have good companions, and, having seen the various treatises, he should prepare the five-colored chalk powder, very fine, clear, and well-mixed.

original: yi ge drug pa'i snying po mngon par bzlas pa'i phye ma dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge drug pa'i snying po mngon par bzlas pa'i phye ma dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The chalk powder, enchanted with the essence of the six-syllable mantra, should be placed in the center of the maṇḍala.

original: phyi rol tu yang rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgreng ba dang / rta babs bzhis brgyan pa /
analyzed: phyi rol tu yang rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgreng ba dang / rta babs bzhis brgyan pa /
translated: Outside, one should erect victory banners and pennants, and it should be adorned with four gateways.

original: chu shing 'bras bu'i tshogs kyis g-yur za ba dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga brdung ba dang / dung gi sgra dang / dga' ba dang / bkra shis pa'i sgra sgrogs pa dag bya'o //
analyzed: chu shing 'bras bu'i tshogs kyis g-yur za ba dang / rnga bo che dang / rdza rnga brdung ba dang / dung gi sgra dang / dga' ba dang / bkra shis pa'i sgra sgrogs pa dag bya'o //
translated: The sound of the fruits of the plantain tree ripening, the sound of the great drum, the sound of the clay drum, the sound of the conch, the sound of joy, and the sound of auspiciousness should be made.

original: zur bzhi nas chos mnyan pa dag la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zur bzhi nas chos mnyan pa dag la bshad par bya'o //
translated: From the four corners, the Dharma should be explained to those who listen.

original: phyogs bzhir theg pa chen po'i mdo sde bklag par bya ba la /
analyzed: phyogs bzhir theg pa chen po'i mdo sde bklag par bya ba la /
translated: In the four directions, the Mahāyāna sūtras should be recited.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lho phyogs su bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lho phyogs su bklag par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed Mother, the Perfection of Wisdom, should be recited in the south.

original: 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin nub phyogs su bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa zla ba sgron ma'i ting nge 'dzin nub phyogs su bklag par bya'o //
translated: The noble Samādhi of the Moon Lamp should be recited in the west.

original: 'phags pa sdong po brgyan pa byang phyogs su bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa sdong po brgyan pa byang phyogs su bklag par bya'o //
translated: The noble Adornment of the Trunk should be recited in the north.

original: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo sde shar phyogs su bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa gser 'od dam pa'i mdo sde shar phyogs su bklag par bya'o //
translated: The noble Sūtra of the Golden Light should be recited in the east.

original: glegs bam dag med na mdo sde bzhi po shes pa'i gang zag chos 'chad pa po la chos mnyan pa'i phyir bskul @101b bar bya'o //
analyzed: glegs bam dag med na mdo sde bzhi po shes pa'i gang zag chos 'chad pa po la chos mnyan pa'i phyir bskul @101b bar bya'o //
translated: If there are no books, one should request a person who knows the four Āgamas to expound the Dharma for the sake of listening to the Dharma.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon langs nas tsandan dang / ga bur dang / gur gum bsres pa'i me tog dri zhim pa dkar po  rtsa ba'i sngags bzlas te /🔽dkyil 'khor de thams cad du chal par dgram par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon langs nas tsandan dang / ga bur dang / gur gum bsres pa'i me tog dri zhim pa dkar po  rtsa ba'i sngags bzlas te / dkyil 'khor de thams cad du chal par dgram par bya'o //
translated: Then, the maṇḍala master, having risen, should scatter white fragrant flowers mixed with sandalwood, camphor, and saffron, while reciting the root mantra,🔽all over that maṇḍala.

original: mngon par bkram pa byas nas phyi rol tu byung ste /
analyzed: mngon par bkram pa byas nas phyi rol tu byung ste /
translated: Having scattered [the flowers], he should come out [of the maṇḍala].

original: zhag bdun gyi bar du 'dod pa'i kha zas bsten pa'i ri mo mkhan gnyis sam /
analyzed: zhag bdun gyi bar du 'dod pa'i kha zas bsten pa'i ri mo mkhan gnyis sam /
translated: For seven days, he should rely on food of desire. Two or three painters

original: gsum byang chub tu sems bskyed pa /
analyzed: gsum byang chub tu sems bskyed pa /
translated: who have generated the mind of enlightenment,

original: gso sbyong nye bar bsten pa /
analyzed: gso sbyong nye bar bsten pa /
translated: who have observed the purificatory fast,

original: mkhas pa dag bcug ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa dag bcug ste /
translated: and who are skilled, should be admitted.

original: rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gtsug phud bcing ba byas la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags kyis gtsug phud bcing ba byas la /
translated: Having bound up their topknots with the root mantra,

original: de nas gser dang / dngul dang / zangs dang / rin po che rnams pa sna tshogs las tshon sna lnga shin tu mdzes pa yid du 'ong ba'i phye ma zhib mo rab tu blangs te /
analyzed: de nas gser dang / dngul dang / zangs dang / rin po che rnams pa sna tshogs las tshon sna lnga shin tu mdzes pa yid du 'ong ba'i phye ma zhib mo rab tu blangs te /
translated: Then, having taken the very fine powders of the five beautiful and pleasing colors made of gold, silver, copper, and various kinds of jewels,

original: longs spyod chen po dang ldan pa dang / chos dang ldan pa'i rgyal po dag 'drir gzhug pa byas na /
analyzed: longs spyod chen po dang ldan pa dang / chos dang ldan pa'i rgyal po dag 'drir gzhug pa byas na /
translated: if the kings who possess great wealth and are righteous have the maṇḍala drawn,

original: dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam gyis nges par byang chub 'thob pa yin na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam gyis nges par byang chub 'thob pa yin na /
translated: they will definitely attain awakening merely by seeing the maṇḍala.

original: sngags sgrub par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos //
analyzed: sngags sgrub par byed pa lta smos kyang ci dgos //
translated: What need is there to mention those who accomplish the mantra?

original: sh'akya'i skyes mchog 'das gyur nas //
analyzed: sh'akya'i skyes mchog 'das gyur nas //
translated: After the passing of the supreme being of the Śākyas,

original: sems can bsod nams chung ba la //
analyzed: sems can bsod nams chung ba la //
translated: how can beings with little merit

original: 'di 'dra'i longs spyod ga la yod //
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i longs spyod ga la yod //
translated: have such enjoyments as these?

original: de bas chog 'di bstan bya //
analyzed: de bas chog 'di bstan bya //
translated: Therefore, this concise version is taught.

original: 'jam dbyangs 'od chen ldan pa yis //
analyzed: 'jam dbyangs 'od chen ldan pa yis //
translated: Mañjughoṣa, endowed with great light,

original: skye bo phongs par gzigs nas ni //
analyzed: skye bo phongs par gzigs nas ni //
translated: having seen the distressed people,

original: nyung zhing dkyil bsdus dkyil 'khor ni //
analyzed: nyung zhing dkyil bsdus dkyil 'khor ni //
translated: the concise and brief maṇḍala

original: mdor bsdus nas ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: mdor bsdus nas ni bstan pa yin //
translated: is taught in brief.

original: 'bras s'a lu dang / thug po che'i @102a *//
analyzed: 'bras s'a lu dang / thug po che'i @102a *//
translated: and very fine flour of wheat

original: phye ma shin tu zhib pa'i tshon sna lnga bzang po /
analyzed: phye ma shin tu zhib pa'i tshon sna lnga bzang po /
translated: are dyed with the five excellent colors,

original: dkar ba dang / ser ba dang / dmar ba dang / nag po dang / ljang gu dag gis bsgyur te /
analyzed: dkar ba dang / ser ba dang / dmar ba dang / nag po dang / ljang gu dag gis bsgyur te /
translated: white, yellow, red, black, and green.

original: sngar bzhag pa'i tshon gyi phye ma slob dpon rang gis blangs nas gtsug phud lnga'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
analyzed: sngar bzhag pa'i tshon gyi phye ma slob dpon rang gis blangs nas gtsug phud lnga'i phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
translated: The master himself takes the previously placed colored powders and forms the great five-crested mudrā.

original: rtsa ba'i sngags kyi bzlas pa byas nas phye ma de la phyag rgya bcing ngo //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sngags kyi bzlas pa byas nas phye ma de la phyag rgya bcing ngo //
translated: Having recited the root mantra, he binds the mudrā on the powders.

original: sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gi slob dpon gyis dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol shar lho mtshams kyi phyogs su cho ga mthong ba'i las kyis thab khung bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gi slob dpon gyis dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol shar lho mtshams kyi phyogs su cho ga mthong ba'i las kyis thab khung bya ste /
translated: The master who is the best of assistants should, outside the maṇḍala, in the southeast direction, make a fire pit with the activity seen in the ritual.

original: rgyar khru do la zabs su khru gang pa /
analyzed: rgyar khru do la zabs su khru gang pa /
translated: Two cubits in width and one cubit in depth,

original: kun nas 'khor bar padma'i ze ba 'dra ba /
analyzed: kun nas 'khor bar padma'i ze ba 'dra ba /
translated: all around it is like the stamen of a lotus.

original: phyi rol yang padma'i ze ba 'dra ba /
analyzed: phyi rol yang padma'i ze ba 'dra ba /
translated: Outside, it is also like the stamen of a lotus.

original: shing pa la sha'i yam shing gis me sbar bar bya /
analyzed: shing pa la sha'i yam shing gis me sbar bar bya /
translated: The fire should be ignited with sticks of the palāśa tree.

original: shing bil ba'i yam shing mtho gang tsam rlon pa la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar la btags pa la rtsa ba'i sngags 'bru drug pa'am /
analyzed: shing bil ba'i yam shing mtho gang tsam rlon pa la zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar la btags pa la rtsa ba'i sngags 'bru drug pa'am /
translated: With the six-syllable root mantra or the essence mantra,🔽the master should summon the fire god with the fist mudra.

original: snying pos khu tshur gyi phyag rgya bcings te me lha spyan drang bar bya'o; ;spyan drangs nas sngar bstan pa nyid kyi rtsa ba'i sngags kyi yi ge gcig pa'i snying pos phyir yang brgya rtsa brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: snying pos khu tshur gyi phyag rgya bcings te me lha spyan drang bar bya'o; ;spyan drangs nas sngar bstan pa nyid kyi rtsa ba'i sngags kyi yi ge gcig pa'i snying pos phyir yang brgya rtsa brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having summoned him, he should again perform one hundred and eight fire offerings with the one-syllable root mantra essence as previously taught.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis cod pan dang / 'tshog chas byas nas bdag nyid dang / ri mo mkhan yang rtse gcig par byas nas sbyin sreg byed du gzhug go /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis cod pan dang / 'tshog chas byas nas bdag nyid dang / ri mo mkhan yang rtse gcig par byas nas sbyin sreg byed du gzhug go /
translated: Then the maṇḍala master, having prepared the turban and implements, should himself make the painting, and having made it one-pointed, should commence the fire offering.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon @102b sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams yid la bya ste /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon @102b sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams yid la bya ste /
translated: Then the maṇḍala master, visualizing the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: sngar bstan pa'i bdug pas bdugs nas thal mo sbyar nas /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i bdug pas bdugs nas thal mo sbyar nas /
translated: should burn incense as previously taught, and with palms joined,

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la rab tu btud nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la rab tu btud nas /
translated: Having bowed to all the bodhisattvas,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la yang phyag byas te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la yang phyag byas te /
translated: and also to the youthful Mañjuśrī,

original: tshon gyi phye ma blangs nas sku'i gzugs kyi sa bcad pa la ri mo mkhan gyi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshon gyi phye ma blangs nas sku'i gzugs kyi sa bcad pa la ri mo mkhan gyi yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: taking the colored powders, the painter should complete the drawing of the image.

original: chog 'di dag gis dang por sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa /
analyzed: chog 'di dag gis dang por sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa /
translated: With these materials, first of all one should paint the Blessed Buddha Śākyamuni himself, endowed with the highest of all aspects,

original: seng+ge'i khri la bzhugs pa gnas gtsang ma'i gzhal med khang na chos ston cing bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: seng+ge'i khri la bzhugs pa gnas gtsang ma'i gzhal med khang na chos ston cing bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: seated on a lion throne, teaching the Dharma in the palace of the Pure Abodes.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon ri mo 'dri ba na 'dir sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gis slob dpon bdag nyid bsrung ba'i phyir rtsa ba'i sngags kyis 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma gtang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon ri mo 'dri ba na 'dir sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gis slob dpon bdag nyid bsrung ba'i phyir rtsa ba'i sngags kyis 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma gtang bar bya ste /
translated: When the maṇḍala master is drawing the picture, here the best assistant for the practice should offer oblations to all the bhūtas with the root mantra in order to protect the master himself.

original: phyi rol gyi phyogs bzhi dang / steng dang / 'og dag tu gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi phyogs bzhi dang / steng dang / 'og dag tu gtor bar bya'o //
translated: He should scatter [the oblations] in the four directions, above and below, outside.

original: de nas khrus byas te thab khung du nye bar song nas gos gtsang ma gos te /
analyzed: de nas khrus byas te thab khung du nye bar song nas gos gtsang ma gos te /
translated: Then, having bathed, he should approach the hearth and put on clean clothes.

original: gtsang sbra dang / srung ba'i chog byas nas gur gum dang bsres pa'i mar gyi sbyin sreg stong rtsa brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: gtsang sbra dang / srung ba'i chog byas nas gur gum dang bsres pa'i mar gyi sbyin sreg stong rtsa brgyad bya'o //
translated: Having performed the purification and protection rites, he should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of ghee mixed with saffron.

original: de nas ku sha'i khres la 'dug nas bzlas pa bya ste /
analyzed: de nas ku sha'i khres la 'dug nas bzlas pa bya ste /
translated: Then, sitting on a bundle of kuśa grass, he should recite the mantra.

original: de nyid du gnas par bya'o //🔽yungs kar la khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje gshed kyi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad kyis mngon par sngags @103a *//
analyzed: de nyid du gnas par bya'o // yungs kar la khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje gshed kyi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad kyis mngon par sngags @103a *//
translated: He should remain right there.

original: la kham por kha sbyar gyi nang du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: la kham por kha sbyar gyi nang du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Having enchanted white mustard seeds one hundred and eight times with the mantra of Yamāntaka, the Lord of Wrath, he should place them inside a pair of joined bowls.

original: bgegs kyi rnam pa 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs can mi bzad pa'i sgra rnam pa du ma rlung dang / char dang / yul ngan gzhan dang / gzhan gang yang rung ba mthong na /
analyzed: bgegs kyi rnam pa 'jigs su rung ba'i gzugs can mi bzad pa'i sgra rnam pa du ma rlung dang / char dang / yul ngan gzhan dang / gzhan gang yang rung ba mthong na /
translated: If he sees any inauspicious forms of obstructors, or hears any terrible sounds, or any other kind of bad omen, such as wind, rain, or storms,

original: khros pa yungs kar chang par bcangs te /
analyzed: khros pa yungs kar chang par bcangs te /
translated: he should become angry, hold the mustard seeds in his joined bowls,

original: lan bdun sbyin sreg byas pa des ni bgegs rab tu 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan bdun sbyin sreg byas pa des ni bgegs rab tu 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: and offer into the fire seven oblations. This will completely destroy the obstructors.

original: mi'i bgegs la ni lan lnga tshang ba nas sbyin sreg byas na skyes bu de rengs par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: mi'i bgegs la ni lan lnga tshang ba nas sbyin sreg byas na skyes bu de rengs par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: If one performs the homa for the obstructors of humans, then that person will become paralyzed,

original: nus pa med par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: nus pa med par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or will become powerless,

original: 'chi bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'chi bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or will die,

original: skad cig de nyid la mi ma yin pas zin par 'gyur ba la nams kyang the tshom med de /🔽brgya byin yang 'chi bar byed na ma rungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i mi'am /
analyzed: skad cig de nyid la mi ma yin pas zin par 'gyur ba la nams kyang the tshom med de / brgya byin yang 'chi bar byed na ma rungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i mi'am /
translated: or will be seized by a non-human being on that very instant.

original: bgegs tha mal pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: bgegs tha mal pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If one can cause Śakra to die, what need is there to mention a wicked person or an ordinary obstructor?

original: khro bo gshin rje gshed kyis 'jigs pas bgegs rnams phan tshun du 'bros shing mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khro bo gshin rje gshed kyis 'jigs pas bgegs rnams phan tshun du 'bros shing mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the fear of the wrathful Yamāntaka, the obstructors will flee and disappear.

original: de nas sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gis de nyid du ku sha'i khres la gnas nas /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gis de nyid du ku sha'i khres la gnas nas /
translated: Then, the excellent practitioner should remain in that very place on a bundle of kuśa grass,

original: khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje gshed kyi bzlas pa byed cing gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje gshed kyi bzlas pa byed cing gnas par bya'o //
translated: and should remain reciting the mantra of the king of wrathful ones, Yamāntaka.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slong dpon gyis bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i sku gzugs kyi g-yas ngos su rang sangs rgyas nyid padma'i gdan la bzhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slong dpon gyis bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i sku gzugs kyi g-yas ngos su rang sangs rgyas nyid padma'i gdan la bzhugs par bya'o //
translated: Then the maṇḍala master should place the Pratyekabuddha on a lotus seat to the right of the image of Lord Śākyamuni.

original: de gnyis kyi 'og tu nyan thos @103b chen po gnyis chos nyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi 'og tu nyan thos @103b chen po gnyis chos nyan par bya'o //
translated: Below those two, the two great śrāvakas should listen to the Dharma.

original: de dag gi yar g-yas su bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: de dag gi yar g-yas su bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: To their right, above them, is the blessed noble Avalokiteśvara, adorned with all ornaments,

original: ston ka'i 'dam bu'i mdog ltar dkar ba /🔽padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: ston ka'i 'dam bu'i mdog ltar dkar ba / padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: white like autumn lotus fibers,🔽seated on a lotus seat,

original: phyag g-yon pa na padma bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa na padma bsnams pa /
translated: holding a lotus in his left hand,

original: phyag g-yas pa mchog sbyin pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa mchog sbyin pa /
translated: and granting boons with his right hand.

original: de'i yang g-yas na bcom ldan 'das yum gos dkar mo /
analyzed: de'i yang g-yas na bcom ldan 'das yum gos dkar mo /
translated: To his right is the Blessed Lady Pāṇḍaravāsinī,

original: phyag g-yon pa na padma bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa na padma bsnams pa /
translated: holding a lotus in her left hand,

original: phyag g-yas pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la phyag 'tshal ba /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la phyag 'tshal ba /
translated: and paying homage to Lord Śākyamuni with her right hand.

original: padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: She is seated on a lotus seat,

original: phyag gser gyi cod pan 'chang ba /
analyzed: phyag gser gyi cod pan 'chang ba /
translated: wearing a golden diadem.

original: der la dkar po'i na bza' mnabs pa /
analyzed: der la dkar po'i na bza' mnabs pa /
translated: There, one should place Pāṇḍaravāsinī,

original: thal ba nag pos thig le gsum byas pa /
analyzed: thal ba nag pos thig le gsum byas pa /
translated: who is dressed in white garments and has three dots of black ash.

original: de bzhin du sgrol ma dang / khro gnyer can yang rang rang gi gnas su spyod lam dag gis gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgrol ma dang / khro gnyer can yang rang rang gi gnas su spyod lam dag gis gnas par bya'o //

original: de dag gi steng du ni bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan dang / gtsug tor gyi rgyal mo rnams bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi steng du ni bcom ldan 'das yum shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan dang / gtsug tor gyi rgyal mo rnams bya'o //
translated: Above them, one should place the Blessed Lady, the Perfection of Wisdom, and the Tathāgatacakṣu and the Uṣṇīṣavijayā.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug bya ba la /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dri ma med par 'gro ba dang / dri ma med @104a *//
analyzed: dri ma med par 'gro ba dang / dri ma med @104a *//
translated: Vimalatejā, Vimalaprabha,

original: pa'i tog dang / nor bzang dang / zla ba'i 'od dang / dri ma med par grags pa dang / nang thams cad gso bar byed pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po dang / 'jig rten 'gro ba dang / blo chen po dang /
analyzed: pa'i tog dang / nor bzang dang / zla ba'i 'od dang / dri ma med par grags pa dang / nang thams cad gso bar byed pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi rgyal po dang / 'jig rten 'gro ba dang / blo chen po dang /
translated: Puṇyatāra, Sudhana, Candraprabha, Vimalakīrti, Sarva­bhavantoṣaṇa, Sarvadharmeśvara-rāja, Lokapāla, Mahāmati,

original: blo bzang po ste /
analyzed: blo bzang po ste /
translated: and Subhadra.

original: sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni lus shin tu zhi ba dang / rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa bri par bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po 'di dag ni lus shin tu zhi ba dang / rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa bri par bya'o //
translated: These great beings should be painted with very peaceful bodies, adorned with all the ornaments.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po'i gtso bo dang / rig pa'i rgyal mo dang / padma'i rigs gzugs dang / phyag rgya lung ji lta ba bzhin gnas ji lta ba ma lus pa dag tu bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po'i gtso bo dang / rig pa'i rgyal mo dang / padma'i rigs gzugs dang / phyag rgya lung ji lta ba bzhin gnas ji lta ba ma lus pa dag tu bri bar bya'o //
translated: The chief of the kings of knowledge, the queen of knowledge, the lotus family, the forms, the seals, and the scriptures should be painted just as they are, in their proper places, without exception.

original: mtha'i gru bzhi'i gnas dag tu ni gnas rnams gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mtha'i gru bzhi'i gnas dag tu ni gnas rnams gzhag par bya'o //

original: padma'i me tog legs par byas pa dang / rig pa'i lha gang dran pa yang de dag tu gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i me tog legs par byas pa dang / rig pa'i lha gang dran pa yang de dag tu gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Well-made lotus flowers and any remembered knowledge deities should be placed there.

analyzed: de bzhin du lho phyogs su bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa dang / 'di sangs rgyas gnyis ni ri spos kyi ngad ldang ba la bzhugs pa bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gyi shar du bdag nyid blta ba dang / thams cad la yang 'jug pa'i sgo rnams bya'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i g-yon phyogs su rang sangs rgyas gzhan gnyis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i g-yon phyogs su rang sangs rgyas gzhan gnyis te /

original: tsandan dang / grub ba zhes bya ba gnyis bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: tsandan dang / grub ba zhes bya ba gnyis bri bar bya'o //
translated: Candana and Siddhārtha.

original: de gnyis kyi 'og tu nyan thos gnyis ni 'od srung chen po dang / k'a ty'a ya na bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi 'og tu nyan thos gnyis ni 'od srung chen po dang / k'a ty'a ya na bri bar bya'o //
translated: Below them, one should paint two śrāvakas, Mahākāśyapa and Kātyāyana.

original: de dag gi yang @104b g-yon du 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje autpa la ltar mdog sngo bsangs gzugs shin tu mdzes pa /
analyzed: de dag gi yang @104b g-yon du 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje autpa la ltar mdog sngo bsangs gzugs shin tu mdzes pa /
translated: To their left, one should paint the noble Vajrapāṇi, blue like a lotus, of very beautiful form,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /🔽lag pa g-yas pa na rnga yab thogs pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa / lag pa g-yas pa na rnga yab thogs pa /

original: g-yon pa khro bo'i lus kyis gnas pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa khro bo'i lus kyis gnas pa /
translated: and with a wrathful body on the left.

original: rdo rje khu tshur ma /🔽rdo rje lcags kyu ma /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur ma / rdo rje lcags kyu ma /
translated: Vajramuṣṭi,🔽Vajrāṅkuśī,🔽Vajrapāśī,

original: rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma /🔽dpung bzang ma /
analyzed: rdo rje lu gu rgyud ma / dpung bzang ma /

analyzed: rdo rje sde ma cha byad ji lta ba bzhin du bgegs kyi gdan la gnas pa /
translated: and Vajrasenā, all of them in their respective forms, standing on the seats of obstructors.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po thams cad dang / rig pa'i rgyal mo 'khor dang bcas pa bzlas pa dang / phyag rgya dang ldan pa ji ltar shes pa bzhin bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po thams cad dang / rig pa'i rgyal mo 'khor dang bcas pa bzlas pa dang / phyag rgya dang ldan pa ji ltar shes pa bzhin bri bar bya'o //
translated: All the kings of knowledge and the queens of knowledge, together with their retinues, should be drawn in accordance with one’s knowledge, with their mantras and their seals.

analyzed: de dag gi yang g-yon du zur bzhir sna tshogs rdo rje'i phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //
translated: To their left, in the four corners, one should draw the seal of the crossed vajra.

analyzed: bris nas kyang gnas gang du rig pa'i tshogs ma dran pa'i gnas de dag kyang bzhugs shig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having drawn them, one should say, “Wherever the assembly of knowledge beings are not remembered, may they remain there.”

original: de'i steng du pha rol du phyin pa drug dang / bcom ldan 'das yum m'a ma k'i bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du pha rol du phyin pa drug dang / bcom ldan 'das yum m'a ma k'i bri bar bya ste /
translated: Above them, one should draw the six perfections and the Blessed Lady, the mother of buddhas.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /

original: gzugs shin tu mdzes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs shin tu mdzes par bya'o //

original: de dag gi steng du gtsug tor gyi rgyal po brgyad kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas rang rang dag gis 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po chen po'i gzugs su bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi steng du gtsug tor gyi rgyal po brgyad kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng ba'i phyag rgya bcings nas rang rang dag gis 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po chen po'i gzugs su bri bar bya ste /

original: gser gyi mdog can dbang po shin tu dul la rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: gser gyi mdog can dbang po shin tu dul la rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: They are golden-colored, their senses are very disciplined, and they are adorned with all ornaments.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la zur gyis lta ba dag la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la zur gyis lta ba dag la /
translated: They glance sideways at the Tathāgata.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gtsug tor 'khor los bsgyur ba dang / @105a *//
analyzed: gtsug tor 'khor los bsgyur ba dang / @105a *//
translated: The uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin,

analyzed: g-yon du bri ba ni rang sangs rgyas rnams so; ;'jug pa'i phyogs kyi sgor ni byang chub sems dpa' gnyis bya ste /

analyzed: g-yas phyogs su ni 'jig rten las 'das par 'gro ba zhes bya ba ral ba'i cod pan 'chang ba; lus zhi ba /

analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa mchog sbyin pas phreng ba 'dzin pa /

analyzed: lag pa g-yon pas spyi blugs 'dzin cing sgo la mngon du phyogs pa /

analyzed: bzhin cung zad khro gnyer dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgo'i g-yon phyogs su ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po ma rgyal ba las rgyal ba zhes bya ba bri bar bya ste /

analyzed: lus rab tu zhi ba / ral pa'i cod pan 'chang ba / lag pa g-yon pa na dbyig pa dang / spyi blugs 'dzin pa /

analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa na mchog sbyin pas phreng ba 'dzin pa /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu rin po che'i gzhal med khang de la gnas pa /

analyzed: @105b bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur ba /

analyzed: gzhon nu'i gzugs can sku mdog dmar skya /

analyzed: zhi ba'i gzugs dang / mdzes pa'i gzugs can; cung zad zhal 'dzum pa /

analyzed: phyag g-yon pa na autpa la sngon po bsnams pa /

original: byis pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: byis pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /

analyzed: dar gyi na bzas smad g-yogs mdzad pa /

original: 'od kun nas 'phro ba /
analyzed: 'od kun nas 'phro ba /

original: 'bar ba'i phreng bas kun nas khyab pa /
analyzed: 'bar ba'i phreng bas kun nas khyab pa /

original: padma'i gdan la nye bar bzhugs pa /
analyzed: padma'i gdan la nye bar bzhugs pa /

original: khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje'i gshed la gzigs pa /
analyzed: khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje'i gshed la gzigs pa /

analyzed: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i sgo la mngon du phyogs pa /

analyzed: de'i g-yas phyogs kyi ngos kyi padma'i 'og tu khro bo'i rgyal po gshin rje'i gshed bri bar bya ste /

original: mi sdug pa chen po'i gzugs can /
analyzed: mi sdug pa chen po'i gzugs can /

original: kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng bas khyab pa /
analyzed: kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng bas khyab pa /

original: bka' len cing 'dzin pa /
analyzed: bka' len cing 'dzin pa /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i phyogs su lta ba'o //

analyzed: g-yon phyogs kyi padma'i 'og tu gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu gzugs can /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lnga bri bar bya ba la /
translated: of five bodhisattvas.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽Suviśuddha, Suvinīta, Śuddha,

analyzed: shin tu dri med dang / shin tu dul ba dang / dag pa dang / @106a *//🔽mun sel dang / kun tu snang ba'o //
translated: Tamonud, and Samantaprabha.

analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang gnas gtsang ma'i gzhal med khang na 'dug pa /
translated: All of them are in the palace of the Pure Abodes.

original: rin po che du ma 'bar ba'i rdo'i steng dang 'dra ba kun nas 'bar ba /
analyzed: rin po che du ma 'bar ba'i rdo'i steng dang 'dra ba kun nas 'bar ba /
translated: They are on a jeweled stone that is like a blazing jewel, completely blazing.

original: me tog sna tshogs kyis gcal bkram pa /
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs kyis gcal bkram pa /
translated: It is strewn with various flowers.

original: shin tu mdzes pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu mdzes pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: They are very beautiful.

original: phyi rol khor yug tu zur bzhi'i rnam par byas te /
analyzed: phyi rol khor yug tu zur bzhi'i rnam par byas te /
translated: Outside, around the perimeter, make the four corners.

original: rta babs bzhi dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rta babs bzhi dang ldan pa /

analyzed: phyogs bzhi nas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i tshon sna lngas gsal bas ri mo shin tu drang ba dang ldan pa nang gi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the four directions, make the inner maṇḍala with clear lines of various five-colored lines.

analyzed: shar gyi bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i steng du ri mo'i dbus su me tog kun nas skyes pa'i rgyal po'i dbang pos padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs cung zad chung bar bya'o //
translated: Above Bhagavān Śākyamuni in the east, in the center of the painting, King Saṃkusumita Rājendra is seated on a lotus seat. The form of the tathāgata should be made slightly smaller.

original: 'od kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng bas khyab pa /
analyzed: 'od kun nas 'bar ba'i phreng bas khyab pa /

original: mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mchog sbyin gyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa /

analyzed: skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa / de'i g-yas su gtsug tor 'khor los bsgyur ba'i phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: g-yon du ni gzi brjid phung po'i phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: mthar gyis tshes grangs bco lnga dang / yar ngo dang / mar ngo'i phyogs dang / khyim bcu gnyis dang / dus drug dang / zla ba bcu gnyis dang / lo tshigs dang / sring mo bzhi gru la zhon pa dang / ming po lnga gru la zhon cing tshul gnas pa ste /
translated: Finally, the fifteen lunar days, the waxing and waning phases, the twelve houses, the six seasons, the twelve months, the year, the four sisters riding in the boat, and the five brothers riding in the boat and abiding in the mode.

original: mdor na phyag rgyar gzhag par bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: mdor na phyag rgyar gzhag par bya ba yang yin no //

analyzed: lha mo de dag mthar gyis rim pa gnyis pa la brten te bya ba yin no //
translated: Those goddesses are to be placed in order on the second level.

original: slob dpon bdag nyid phyi rol tu byung nas dkyil 'khor de la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te /🔽mdor na dkyil 'khor gsum yang dkyil 'khor gsum la brten cing bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: slob dpon bdag nyid phyi rol tu byung nas dkyil 'khor de la g-yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te / mdor na dkyil 'khor gsum yang dkyil 'khor gsum la brten cing bri bar bya ste /
translated: The master himself, having come outside, circumambulates that maṇḍala to the right.🔽In brief, the three maṇḍalas are also to be drawn in dependence on the three maṇḍalas.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum char yang gru bzhir rnam par gnas par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum char yang gru bzhir rnam par gnas par bya ba yin no //

original: mdor na / 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi mgon po ni nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na / 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi mgon po ni nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: In brief, the Blessed Buddha, the protector of sentient beings, should definitely be painted.

original: padma'i rigs 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug kyang nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i rigs 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug kyang nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: The noble Avalokiteśvara of the Lotus family should also definitely be painted.

original: rdo rje'i rigs 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'ang nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje'ang nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: The noble Vajrapāṇi of the Vajra family should also definitely be painted.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtso bo 'phags pa kun tu bzang po'ang nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtso bo 'phags pa kun tu bzang po'ang nges par bri bar bya'o //

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa yang nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa yang nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: The youthful Mañjuśrī should also definitely be painted.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag @109b pa bzhin phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag @109b pa bzhin phyag rgya bri bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining ones should be painted with their respective mudrās, as prescribed.

original: 'di ni nang gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'di ni nang gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the inner maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor bar ma la yang shar phyogs su ni mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bar ma la yang shar phyogs su ni mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the middle maṇḍala, Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, should be painted in the east.

original: de bzhin du 'od gsal ba ni lho phyogs su'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'od gsal ba ni lho phyogs su'o //
translated: Similarly, Bhīṣma should be painted in the south.

original: 'og min gyi gzugs can rnams lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par ro //
analyzed: 'og min gyi gzugs can rnams lha'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par ro //
translated: Those who have the form of Akaniṣṭha are in the form of a divine maṇḍala.🔽Up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception should not be expressed.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi bar ni brjod par mi bya'o; ;byang phyogs su brgya byin lha'i rgyal po dang / rab 'thab bral dang / yongs su dga' ldan dang / rab 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched kyi bar ni brjod par mi bya'o; ;byang phyogs su brgya byin lha'i rgyal po dang / rab 'thab bral dang / yongs su dga' ldan dang / rab 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang /
translated: In the north, Śakra, king of the gods, and the sons of the gods Suyāma, Saṃtuṣita, Sunirmāṇarati, Paranirmitavaśavartin,

analyzed: 'od chung la sogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams nges par lha'i rgyal po re re bya'o //
translated: and Caturmahārājika, and so forth, should definitely be drawn as each king of the gods.

original: lhag ma rnams ni phyag rgyar gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni phyag rgyar gnas par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be drawn as seals.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gsum par yang byang phyogs su 'byung po'i bdag po dbang ldan dka' thub zlog ma dang bcas pa nges par bri'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gsum par yang byang phyogs su 'byung po'i bdag po dbang ldan dka' thub zlog ma dang bcas pa nges par bri'o //
translated: Similarly, in the third maṇḍala, in the north, the lord of spirits, Īśāna, together with his wife, should definitely be drawn.

original: 'jam dpal gyi sgo gnyis pa'i sgo'i drung du ni smin drug gi bu rma bya'i stan yod pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyi sgo gnyis pa'i sgo'i drung du ni smin drug gi bu rma bya'i stan yod pa /
translated: In front of the door of Mañjuśrī's second door, Ṣaṇmukha, with a peacock seat,

original: lag na mdung thogs pa /
analyzed: lag na mdung thogs pa /
translated: holding a spear in his hand,

original: lus kyi kha dog dmar pa /
analyzed: lus kyi kha dog dmar pa /
translated: his body red in color,

original: gos ser pos stod g-yogs dang / gos byas pa /
analyzed: gos ser pos stod g-yogs dang / gos byas pa /
translated: He is wearing a yellow upper garment and lower garment,

original: lag pa g-yas pa na dril bu dang / ba dan thogs pa /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa na dril bu dang / ba dan thogs pa /
translated: holding a bell and a flag in his right hand,

original: gzhon nu'i gzugs can 'khor la lta ba'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu'i gzugs can 'khor la lta ba'o //
translated: and he has the form of a youth, looking at his retinue.

analyzed: shar phyogs su ni nam mkha' lding 'dab chags kyi gzugs can dang / drang srong gi nang nas mar kanda nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the east, one should paint Garuḍa in the form of a bird, and the sage Markaṇḍa.

original: lhag ma ni ji ltar gnas pa @110a *//
analyzed: lhag ma ni ji ltar gnas pa @110a *//
translated: The rest should be painted as they are situated.

original: bzhin phyag rgyar bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin phyag rgyar bri bar bya'o //
translated: They should be painted with their respective seals.

original: shar lhor ni gzhon nu ma bzhi dang / ming po gzhon nu dang bcas pa /
analyzed: shar lhor ni gzhon nu ma bzhi dang / ming po gzhon nu dang bcas pa /

original: gru'i bzhon pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: gru'i bzhon pa la gnas pa /
translated: residing on a boat,

analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po la rnam par rgyu ba dang / me lha'i rgyal po yang nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: wandering in the great ocean, and also the king of the fire god.

original: de bzhin du lho phyogs su ni srin po'i bdag po las ni grong khyer lang ka'i bdag po bi bhi sha na shing pi tsu mrda la gnas pa dang / dzambha la chu dbang zhes bya ba gnod sbyin gyi gzugs can byang chub sems dpa' nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho phyogs su ni srin po'i bdag po las ni grong khyer lang ka'i bdag po bi bhi sha na shing pi tsu mrda la gnas pa dang / dzambha la chu dbang zhes bya ba gnod sbyin gyi gzugs can byang chub sems dpa' nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, in the south, one should paint the lord of rākṣasas, the king of Laṅkā, Vibhīṣaṇa, dwelling on the pippala tree, and the yakṣa Jambhala, the lord of water, in the form of a bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin du mthar gyis gshin rje'i rgyal po yi dvags rdzu 'phrul chen po nges par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthar gyis gshin rje'i rgyal po yi dvags rdzu 'phrul chen po nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, in due order, one should paint the king of the yāmas, the lord of the pretas, of great magic.

analyzed: de bzhin du sha za'i rgyal po rnam par g-yengs byed ces bya ba nges par bri bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should paint the king of the piśācas, called Vikarāla.

analyzed: lhag ma ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin phyag rgyar bri rar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be painted according to their places, with their seals.

analyzed: de bzhin du lho nub kyi mtshams su ni klu'i gtso bo dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo nges par bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: gza'i gtso bo nyi ma bri bar bya'o //

analyzed: nub phyogs su ni drang srong thub pa'i mchog gcar bu pa mu stegs kyi mchog gcer bu'i gzugs bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the west, the supreme sage, the Muni, should be painted in the form of the supreme tīrthika Nirgrantha.

original: lhag ma ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin phyag rgyar bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin phyag rgyar bri bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be painted in their respective places, in their respective forms.

original: nub byang mtshams su ni gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po mchog sbyin dang / dri za'i rgyal po gtsug phud lnga pa dang / mi'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pa nges par bri bar bya'o //

translated: In the northwest corner, the supreme yakṣa lord, the giver of gifts, should be painted, as well as the gandharva king Pañcaśikha and the kinnara king Druma.

analyzed: @110b lhag ma ni gnas ji lta ba dang / dbyibs ji lta ba bzhin du phyag rgyar bri bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be painted in their respective places, in their respective forms.

analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi pa byi rol tu ri mo lngar bkod de /

analyzed: phyag rgya'i phreng bas nye bar mdzes par byas pa; zur bzhi nas rta babs bzhi dang / rgyal po chen po bzhis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with a garland of mudrās, with four gateways and four archways, adorned with the four great kings.

original: ji ltar gnas pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa la /
translated: In their respective places,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely:

analyzed: phyag rgyar 'gyur ba ni sgor 'jug pa la autpa la sngon po bri'o //
translated: At the entrance to the gate, a blue lotus should be drawn.

analyzed: g-yas dang; g-yon gyi phyogs su ni padma /

original: rdo rje / dgra sta /
analyzed: rdo rje / dgra sta /
translated: Vajras, swords,

original: ral gri / mdung dang / mdung rtse gsum pa dang / ga d'a dang / 'khor lo dang / sra sti ka dang / bum pa dang / nya dang / dung dang; gdub kor dang / spyi blugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang /

analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi phyogs bzhir rgya mtsho chen po gzhag par bya ste /

analyzed: byang phyogs su ni dkyil 'khor gru bzhir bya ste /

analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje rtse gsum yod pa kun nas 'bar ba bya'o //

analyzed: shar phyogs su ni dkyil 'khor gzhu'i dbyibs can byas te bzhag la kun nas 'bar ba'i padma'i phyag rgyas mtshan pa'o //

analyzed: lho phyogs su ni dkyil 'khor zur gsum pa byas te /

analyzed: autpa la sngon po sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang bcas pa kun nas 'bar bas mtshan pa'o //

analyzed: phyogs mtshams bzhir yang phyag rgya bri bar bya ba yin te /

analyzed: sems can rnams la phan bzhed nas // dkyil 'khor gyi ni cho ga rnams //
translated: wishing to benefit sentient beings,

analyzed: 'dir ni mdor bsdus bstan pa yin //
translated: has taught here in brief🔽the ritual of the maṇḍala.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis dang po nyid du slob ma gzung bar bya ba la /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis dang po nyid du slob ma gzung bar bya ba la /
translated: Then, the maṇḍala master should first select the disciples.

translated: who is always anointed, who sits on a bundle of kuśa grass, who has performed the rite of protection, who is celibate, who is truthful, who has conquered the harmful influences, who is seated outside the maṇḍala, not too far from it,

original: ha cang yang @112a *//
analyzed: ha cang yang @112a *//
translated: and not too close to it.

original: mi ring bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mi ring bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should be seated.

original: shin tu gtsang ba dang / shin tu gtsang sbra dang ldan pa gcig nas brgyad kyi bar te /
analyzed: shin tu gtsang ba dang / shin tu gtsang sbra dang ldan pa gcig nas brgyad kyi bar te /
translated: They are very clean and very pure, from one to eight.

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa de dag kyang phan tshun gnyen du 'brel ba /
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa de dag kyang phan tshun gnyen du 'brel ba /
translated: They are not others than that, and they are mutually related as relatives.

original: rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po dag gi bu gzhon nu ma'am /
analyzed: rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'i rgyal po chen po dag gi bu gzhon nu ma'am /
translated: They are the sons or daughters of great kings who are anointed kṣatriyas.

original: gzhon nu grong gi chos mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu grong gi chos mi shes pa'o //
translated: They are young people who do not know the ways of the world.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhon nu'i gzugs can byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal ni byis pa'i skye bo dga' bar byed pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhon nu'i gzugs can byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal ni byis pa'i skye bo dga' bar byed pa /
translated: Blessed One, the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī, who has the form of a youth, delights young people.

original: gzhon nu'i rol pa la dgyes pa des na /
analyzed: gzhon nu'i rol pa la dgyes pa des na /
translated: He delights in the play of youth.

original: dang po nyid du gzhon nu nang du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po nyid du gzhon nu nang du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he should be placed among young people first.

original: rgyal po chen po mngon par 'phel ba dang / tshe dang / nad med pa dang / dbang phyug dang / skal ba chen po mngon par 'phel ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po mngon par 'phel ba dang / tshe dang / nad med pa dang / dbang phyug dang / skal ba chen po mngon par 'phel ba yin te /
translated: Great King, it increases glory, life, health, power, and great fortune.

original: khyad par du byis pa rnams la nges par sngags grub pas grub pa gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par du byis pa rnams la nges par sngags grub pas grub pa gnas pa yin te /
translated: In particular, the children must definitely be established in the mantra [system] by one who has accomplished [the mantra practice].

original: de dag sngar gzhag pa byas nas grogs po bag yod pa bzang po dang ldan pas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis ga pur gyi bdug pas bdugs te /
analyzed: de dag sngar gzhag pa byas nas grogs po bag yod pa bzang po dang ldan pas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis ga pur gyi bdug pas bdugs te /
translated: Having previously established them, the maṇḍala master, who is endowed with a good, careful friend, should fumigate with camphor.

original: rgyab kyis phyogs pa ma yin pas phyi rol tu byung bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs pa ma yin pas phyi rol tu byung bar bya ste /
translated: Having come out from the maṇḍala without turning his back,

original: byung nas dus dang / ji ltar mthun pa'i chu legs par gtsang sbra byas pa dang / srog chags med pa la rtsa ba'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas te /
analyzed: byung nas dus dang / ji ltar mthun pa'i chu legs par gtsang sbra byas pa dang / srog chags med pa la rtsa ba'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas te /
translated: having come out, he should perform ablutions with water that is in accord with the time, well-purified, and free of living organisms, having enchanted it one hundred and eight times with the root mantra.

original: gtsug phud lnga'i phyag rgya chen pos @112b phyag rgyar byas pa'i chus khrus byas la nye reg byas nas gos gtsang ma bgos pa'i gtsang bas me thab kyi drung du song ste /
analyzed: gtsug phud lnga'i phyag rgya chen pos @112b phyag rgyar byas pa'i chus khrus byas la nye reg byas nas gos gtsang ma bgos pa'i gtsang bas me thab kyi drung du song ste /
translated: Having performed ablutions with the water that is sealed with the great five-crested mudrā, and having performed the rite of sprinkling, he should go to the hearth, wearing clean clothes,

original: ku sha'i khres la 'dug nas byang shar gyi phyogs su mngon par bltas te /
analyzed: ku sha'i khres la 'dug nas byang shar gyi phyogs su mngon par bltas te /
translated: and, sitting on a bundle of kuśa grass, he should face the northeast.

original: mar gyi sbyin sreg ga pur dang / gur gum dang / tsandan bsres pas stong rtsa brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: mar gyi sbyin sreg ga pur dang / gur gum dang / tsandan bsres pas stong rtsa brgyad bya'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of clarified butter mixed with camphor, saffron, and sandalwood.

original: sngar bshad pa'i chogs spyan drang ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba bya ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i chogs spyan drang ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba bya ste /
translated: One should invite the deities with the previously explained ritual and request their departure.

original: yang dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dkyil 'khor du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: One should then enter the maṇḍala.

original: nges par yang bum pa gang ba brgyad ras gtsang ma'i gos dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nges par yang bum pa gang ba brgyad ras gtsang ma'i gos dang ldan pa /
translated: One should definitely offer eight filled vases, each covered with a clean cloth,

original: shing aa mra'i lo ma dang / 'bras bu dang ldan pa /
analyzed: shing aa mra'i lo ma dang / 'bras bu dang ldan pa /
translated: each containing a leaf and fruit of the mango tree,

original: gser dang / dngul dang / rin po che dang / 'bras dang / 'bru nang du bcug pa gcig bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la dbul lo //
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / rin po che dang / 'bras dang / 'bru nang du bcug pa gcig bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la dbul lo //
translated: and each containing gold, silver, jewels, rice, and grain. One should offer one of these to the Blessed One Śākyamuni.

original: gnyis pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad la'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad la'o //
translated: The second one is for all the buddhas.

original: gsum pa ni rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / 'phags pa nyan thos la'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / 'phags pa nyan thos la'o //
translated: The third is for all the pratyekabuddhas and noble śrāvakas.

original: bzhi pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad la'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad la'o //
translated: The fourth is for all the great bodhisattvas.

original: lnga pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa 'jam dpal la'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa 'jam dpal la'o //
translated: The fifth is for the noble bodhisattva Mañjuśrī.

original: drug pa ni lha thams cad la'o /
analyzed: drug pa ni lha thams cad la'o /
translated: The sixth one is for all the gods.

original: bdun pa dang / brgyad pa ni dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i sgo khang la gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: bdun pa dang / brgyad pa ni dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i sgo khang la gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The seventh and eighth ones should be placed in the portico of the second maṇḍala.

original: gcig ni 'byung po thams cad la'o //
analyzed: gcig ni 'byung po thams cad la'o //
translated: One is for all the bhūtas.

original: gcig ni sems can thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur bar bsngos nas gzhag par bya'o //🔽de bas na sngar bshad pa'i cho @113a *//
analyzed: gcig ni sems can thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur bar bsngos nas gzhag par bya'o // de bas na sngar bshad pa'i cho @113a *//
translated: One should be dedicated and placed for the common weal of all sentient beings.

original: gas spyan drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gas spyan drang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should invite with the previously explained rite.

original: de bzhin du me tog dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / mar me dang / lha bshos kyang sngar bstan pa nyid kyi las kyis dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du me tog dang / bdug pa dang / dri dang / mar me dang / lha bshos kyang sngar bstan pa nyid kyi las kyis dbul bar bya ste /
translated: Likewise, one should offer flowers, incense, perfume, lamps, and food with the previously taught rite.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du go rims bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du go rims bzhin du bya'o //
translated: Everything should be done in order.

original: mar me 'dzin pas mar gyi mar me gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: mar me 'dzin pas mar gyi mar me gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One who holds a lamp should hold a lamp of ghee.

original: 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa thams cad la lha bshos zhes smos pa ni 'bras s'a lu'i chan zho dang bcas pa dang / sbrang rtsi dang ldan pa'i 'o thug khyad par can gyis nye bar sbyar ba'i mar la btsos pa'i snum khur gyis 'breng bu la sogs pa dang /🔽khanda la sogs pa'i bza' ba thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
