translated: The term sacrificial cake refers to rice boiled with milk and curds, and to special rice porridge with honey, as well as to oil-cakes fried in ghee, and so on, and to all kinds of food such as khaṇḍa, which should be offered to all the Tathāgatas.🔽The term sacrificial cake refers to rice boiled with milk and curds, and to special rice porridge with honey, as well as to oil-cakes fried in ghee, and so on, and to all kinds of food such as khaṇḍa, which should be offered to all the Tathāgatas.🔽The term sacrificial cake refers to rice boiled with milk and curds, and to special rice porridge with honey, as well as to oil-cakes fried in ghee, and so on, and to all kinds of food such as khaṇḍa, which should be offered to all the Tathāgatas.🔽The term sacrificial cake refers to rice boiled with milk and curds, and to special rice porridge with honey, as well as to oil-cakes fried in ghee, and so on, and to all kinds of food such as khaṇḍa, which should be offered to all the Tathāgatas.🔽The term sacrificial cake refers to rice boiled with milk and curds, and to special rice porridge with honey, as well as to oil-cakes fried in ghee, and so on, and to all kinds of food such as khaṇḍa, which should be offered to all the Tathāgatas.

original: mar gyis gang ba dang; tsandan gyi thang chu sbrang rtsi'i snying po dang / 'o mar btsos pa'i bza' ba ni rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang / 'phags pa'i lha thams cad la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mar gyis gang ba dang; tsandan gyi thang chu sbrang rtsi'i snying po dang / 'o mar btsos pa'i bza' ba ni rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang / 'phags pa'i lha thams cad la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The term sacrificial cake refers to rice boiled with milk and curds, and to special rice porridge with honey, as well as to oil-cakes fried in ghee, and so on, and to all kinds of food such as khaṇḍa, which should be offered to all the Tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin du garbhod au lo pi ka ri ka dang / khyad par du snum khur gyi yo byad 'byung po thams cad dang / sems can thams cad la sngags dang ldan pa'i chogs sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du garbhod au lo pi ka ri ka dang / khyad par du snum khur gyi yo byad 'byung po thams cad dang / sems can thams cad la sngags dang ldan pa'i chogs sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should offer the Garbhoḍī ornaments, the verses, and in particular the oil-cake substances to all the bhūtas and all beings with the mantra and the rite.

original: de bzhin du me tog dri zhim pa sna ma'i me tog dang / rgya spos dang / klu'i me tog dang / me tog bun @113b sdug  la sogs pa sngar bstan pa sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du me tog dri zhim pa sna ma'i me tog dang / rgya spos dang / klu'i me tog dang / me tog bun @113b sdug  la sogs pa sngar bstan pa sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang /
translated: Likewise, one should offer the fragrant flowers such as jasmine, sandalwood, nāga flowers, and the fragrant flowers such as the blue lotus, to all the Buddhas, Pratyekabuddhas, noble Śrāvakas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang / 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i lha rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang / 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa'i lha rnams la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: great Bodhisattvas, noble and non-noble gods, and to all beings.

original: khyad par du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la ni sna ma'i me tog dang / padma'i rigs la ni me tog padma dang / de bzhin du rdo rje'i rigs la ni me tog autpa la dang / lha gzhan dag la ni gzhan gang yang rung bas dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la ni sna ma'i me tog dang / padma'i rigs la ni me tog padma dang / de bzhin du rdo rje'i rigs la ni me tog autpa la dang / lha gzhan dag la ni gzhan gang yang rung bas dbul bar bya'o //
translated: In particular, for the Tathāgata family, one should offer jasmine flowers; for the Lotus family, lotus flowers; and for the Vajra family, utpala flowers. For other deities, one should offer whatever is appropriate.

original: ga bur gyi bdug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la'o //
analyzed: ga bur gyi bdug pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la'o //
translated: Camphor incense is for the Tathāgata family.

original: tsandan ni padma'i rigs la'o //
analyzed: tsandan ni padma'i rigs la'o //
translated: Sandalwood is for the Lotus family.

original: de bzhin du gu gul ni gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gu gul ni gsang ba'i bdag po phyag na rdo rje la shes par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should know that frankincense is for the Lord of Secrets Vajrapāṇi.

original: lha gzhan thams cad ni bdug pa tha ma la bas bya'o //
analyzed: lha gzhan thams cad ni bdug pa tha ma la bas bya'o //
translated: For all other deities, one should offer the lowest incense.

original: mar gyi mar me 'phags pa rnams //
analyzed: mar gyi mar me 'phags pa rnams //
translated: The noble ones are offered butter lamps,

original: thams cad la ni dbul bar bya //
analyzed: thams cad la ni dbul bar bya //
translated: and all are offered.

original: 'phags min lha ni thams cad la /
analyzed: 'phags min lha ni thams cad la /
translated: For all non-noble deities,

original: dri zhim 'bru mar dbul bar bya //
analyzed: dri zhim 'bru mar dbul bar bya //
translated: fragrant oil lamps are offered.

original: cho ga ji bzhin rim pas ni //
analyzed: cho ga ji bzhin rim pas ni //
translated: In the proper sequence, according to the ritual,

original: bdug pa mthong ba'i rgyu yis so //
analyzed: bdug pa mthong ba'i rgyu yis so //
translated: due to the cause of seeing incense.

original: de ltar gsungs pa de bzhin dri //
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa de bzhin dri //
translated: Thus it is said, and likewise with fragrance.

original: sngags rnams kun la rtag tu bya //
analyzed: sngags rnams kun la rtag tu bya //
translated: One should always do this for all mantras.🔽Whatever was taught to Avalokiteśvara,

original: spyan ras gzigs la gang gsungs dang // gang gsungs phyag na rdo rje la //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs la gang gsungs dang // gang gsungs phyag na rdo rje la //
translated: and whatever was taught to Vajrapāṇi,

original: rang rang gi ni sngags dag gis //
analyzed: rang rang gi ni sngags dag gis //
translated: one should accomplish with their respective mantras

original: sngags spyod don du sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sngags spyod don du sgrub pa'o //
translated: for the sake of mantra practice.

original: cho ga gcig bu blta bya ste //
analyzed: cho ga gcig bu blta bya ste //
translated: One should consult only the single ritual,

original: rtag tu rjes su mthun par bya //
analyzed: rtag tu rjes su mthun par bya //
translated: always acting in accordance with it.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis sngar mthong ba'i cho @114a *//
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis sngar mthong ba'i cho @114a *//
translated: Then the maṇḍala master, having invited the deity with the previously seen ritual,

original: gas spyan drang ba dang / mchod pa dang / bdug pa la sogs pa byas nas gtsor mthun pa'i bya ba byas te /
analyzed: gas spyan drang ba dang / mchod pa dang / bdug pa la sogs pa byas nas gtsor mthun pa'i bya ba byas te /
translated: having made offerings, incense offerings, and so forth, should perform the principal concordant activities.

original: de'i 'og tu sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gis mkhas pa dang / myur bas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma sha med pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gis mkhas pa dang / myur bas 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma sha med pa /
translated: After that, the best assistant to the practice, skilled and quick, should offer the bali to all the bhūtas, without meat,🔽accompanied by the sounds of musical instruments such as paṭaha drums and conches, and so forth.

original: kun nas rnga pa ta ha dang / dung gi sgra dga' ba'i sgra sgrogs pa la sogs pa des bdug pa dang / spos dang / me tog dang / phreng bas brgyan pa'i phyogs bzhi /
analyzed: kun nas rnga pa ta ha dang / dung gi sgra dga' ba'i sgra sgrogs pa la sogs pa des bdug pa dang / spos dang / me tog dang / phreng bas brgyan pa'i phyogs bzhi /
translated: With incense, flowers, and garlands, he should adorn the four directions.

original: mtshams brgyad / steng dang / 'og dang / thad ka thams cad du dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol tu bskor ba bya zhing 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma rgya cher gtong bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams brgyad / steng dang / 'og dang / thad ka thams cad du dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol tu bskor ba bya zhing 'byung po thams cad pa'i gtor ma rgya cher gtong bar bya'o //
translated: He should circumambulate the maṇḍala in all directions, above, below, and across, and make extensive offerings of bali to all the bhūtas.

original: de nas khrus byas te yang zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis bsgos pa'i s'a lu dang / 'bras thug po che'i sbyin sreg rtsa ba'i sngags yi ge drug pa dang / snying pos stong rtsa brgyad bya'o //
analyzed: de nas khrus byas te yang zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis bsgos pa'i s'a lu dang / 'bras thug po che'i sbyin sreg rtsa ba'i sngags yi ge drug pa dang / snying pos stong rtsa brgyad bya'o //
translated: Then, having bathed, he should perform a homa of rice and wheat smeared with curd, honey, and ghee, with the root mantra, the six-syllable mantra, and the essence mantra, one thousand and eight times each.

original: sbyin sreg byas nas dkyil 'khor la rjes su bcug cing sngar bzhag pa'i sems dpa' chen po la srung ba byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyi slob ma nyid du khas blangs pa /
analyzed: sbyin sreg byas nas dkyil 'khor la rjes su bcug cing sngar bzhag pa'i sems dpa' chen po la srung ba byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyi slob ma nyid du khas blangs pa /
translated: Having performed the homa, he should enter the maṇḍala and, having protected the previously placed great being, he should accept him as his own disciple of the maṇḍala master.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa /
translated: He should generate the mind of awakening in him,

original: gso sbyong byas pa /
analyzed: gso sbyong byas pa /
translated: administer the purificatory fast,

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la bdag nyid kyi lus phul ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la bdag nyid kyi lus phul ba /
translated: and offer himself to the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: dngos grub kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi nye bar longs spyod pa dang / yongs su longs spyod pa thun mong du gyur pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa'i byang @114b chub kyi snying po gnon par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sangs rgyas thob par bya ba la dkyil 'khor bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi nye bar longs spyod pa dang / yongs su longs spyod pa thun mong du gyur pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa'i byang @114b chub kyi snying po gnon par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sangs rgyas thob par bya ba la dkyil 'khor bstan par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of spiritual powers, for the enjoyment and full enjoyment of all sentient beings, for the commonality of the essence of unsurpassed enlightenment, and for the attainment of buddhahood with omniscient wisdom, the maṇḍala should be revealed.

original: bstan ba tsam nyid kyis sdig pa'i rnyog pa thams cad las grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bstan ba tsam nyid kyis sdig pa'i rnyog pa thams cad las grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: By the mere revelation, all the impurities of evil are liberated.

original: mtshams med pa lnga byed pa'i skye bo yang de ma thag tu grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga byed pa'i skye bo yang de ma thag tu grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even those who have committed the five acts of immediate retribution are immediately liberated.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis ras ma nyams pa thag mas btags ma thags pa skra med pa la rtsa ba'i sngags kyis lan gsum bzlas te /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis ras ma nyams pa thag mas btags ma thags pa skra med pa la rtsa ba'i sngags kyis lan gsum bzlas te /
translated: Then the maṇḍala master, with a new, undamaged, uncut cloth free from hair, should recite the root mantra three times.

original: dri zhim po'i tsandan dang / gur gum gyis bsgos pa'i ras kyi gdong g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dri zhim po'i tsandan dang / gur gum gyis bsgos pa'i ras kyi gdong g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: The face should be covered with a cloth scented with fragrant sandalwood and saffron.

original: dang por byis pa lo gsum nas lo bcu drug pa'i bar zur phud lngas nye bar mdzes pa'am /🔽gtsug phud gcig gis nye bar mdzes pa'am /
analyzed: dang por byis pa lo gsum nas lo bcu drug pa'i bar zur phud lngas nye bar mdzes pa'am / gtsug phud gcig gis nye bar mdzes pa'am /
translated: First, the child, from the age of three up to the age of sixteen, is beautified by five locks of hair,🔽or by one lock of hair,

original: gtsug phud kyis nye bar mdzes ba skra dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gtsug phud kyis nye bar mdzes ba skra dang ldan pa /
translated: or by a lock of hair on the crown of the head, and has hair.

original: rgyal po'i bu spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'am /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba'am /
translated: The son of a king who has been consecrated on the crown of the head,

original: rgyal rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: or the son of a kṣatriya,

original: gzhan bdag nyid chen po rgyal po chen po 'dod pa dkyil 'khor du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan bdag nyid chen po rgyal po chen po 'dod pa dkyil 'khor du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: or another great being, a great king, should be made to enter the maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa la phyin pa na gdong g-yogs par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa la phyin pa na gdong g-yogs par bya ste /
translated: Having arrived at the second maṇḍala, he should be blindfolded.

original: autpa la'i phyag rgya bcings nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rtsa ba'i sngags lan gcig brjod du gzhug ste /
analyzed: autpa la'i phyag rgya bcings nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rtsa ba'i sngags lan gcig brjod du gzhug ste /
translated: Having formed the utpala mudrā, he should be made to recite the root mantra of Mañjuśrī the Youth once.

original: me tog dri zhim po tsandan dang / gur gum dang bsres pa shin tu gtsang ba byas pa /
analyzed: me tog dri zhim po tsandan dang / gur gum dang bsres pa shin tu gtsang ba byas pa /
translated: Having made a very pure flower, fragrant and mixed with sandalwood and saffron,

original: lag pa gnyis su byin la me tog 'dor du bzhug go /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis su byin la me tog 'dor du bzhug go /
translated: he should be made to cast the flower into the two hands.

original: gang du de'i me tog babs pa der de'i sngags sbyin par bya @115a *//
analyzed: gang du de'i me tog babs pa der de'i sngags sbyin par bya @115a *//
translated: Wherever his flower falls, there he should be given the mantra.

original: ste; sngags 'di ni de'i yin par bstan te /
analyzed: ste; sngags 'di ni de'i yin par bstan te /
translated: This is the mantra of that one,

original: skye ba brgyud pa nas de dang rjes su 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: skye ba brgyud pa nas de dang rjes su 'brel ba yin te /
translated: which has been connected with him since the beginning of time.

original: de nyid dge ba'i bshes gnyen byang chub kyi snying po la gnon pa /
analyzed: de nyid dge ba'i bshes gnyen byang chub kyi snying po la gnon pa /
translated: That very one is the spiritual friend who is seated on the seat of awakening,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du mngon par sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du mngon par sgrub par byed pa /
translated: who accomplishes the great bodhisattva for the sake of perfecting the gnosis of omniscience,

original: longs spyod chen po dang / rgyal po chen po dang / grags pa chen po dang / gang zag rtse gcig par mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po dang / rgyal po chen po dang / grags pa chen po dang / gang zag rtse gcig par mngon par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: who accomplishes the great enjoyments, the great kingship, the great fame, and the single person,

original: tshe 'di nyid la'ang chos thams cad la the tshom med par bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la'ang chos thams cad la the tshom med par bsgrub par bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: and who accomplishes the absence of doubt regarding all phenomena in this very life.

original: de bzhin du mthar gyis dngos grub 'dod pas brgya snyed kyi bar du bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthar gyis dngos grub 'dod pas brgya snyed kyi bar du bya ste /
translated: In the same way, one should perform up to a hundred times for the sake of the desired accomplishments,

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for others.

original: gzhan dag la ji ltar sdig pa spang ba'i phyir dam tshig tsam sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ji ltar sdig pa spang ba'i phyir dam tshig tsam sbyin par bya'o //
translated: For others, one should give only the samaya in order to abandon evil.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis dbang bskur na dang por re zhig dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol ha cang yang mi nye /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis dbang bskur na dang por re zhig dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol ha cang yang mi nye /
translated: If the maṇḍala master is to confer empowerment, first, not too close to,

original: ha cang yang mi ring bar byang shar gyis phyogs su rtsa ba'i sngags kyis dag par byas pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: ha cang yang mi ring bar byang shar gyis phyogs su rtsa ba'i sngags kyis dag par byas pas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: but not too far from the maṇḍala, he should consecrate the ground in the northeast with the root mantra.

original: rgyal po dbang bskur ba bzhin du bdag nyid sems pa dang / gcig tu sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la dad cing dang ba dang / spro ba chen po dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral ba dang /
analyzed: rgyal po dbang bskur ba bzhin du bdag nyid sems pa dang / gcig tu sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la dad cing dang ba dang / spro ba chen po dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral ba dang /
translated: Like a king being consecrated, he should be intelligent, have faith and clear faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, be endowed with great enthusiasm, not be separated from the thought of awakening,

original: theg pa chen po la zhugs pa @115b dang; dkon mchog gsum la phan par byed pa dang / dbang po mtshang ba med pa dang / ma smad pa dang / tshe 'di nyid la sngags 'grub par 'dod pa dang / bsam pa bzang ba dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la zhugs pa @115b dang; dkon mchog gsum la phan par byed pa dang / dbang po mtshang ba med pa dang / ma smad pa dang / tshe 'di nyid la sngags 'grub par 'dod pa dang / bsam pa bzang ba dang /
translated: be engaged in the Great Vehicle, be one who benefits the Three Jewels, have unimpaired faculties, be irreproachable, desire to accomplish the mantra in this very life, have a good motivation,

original: sngags kyi spyod pa la spro ba dang / blta bar 'dod pa'i rang bzhin can dang / sad par 'dod pa'i phyir yang sngags kyi don pa rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / der gtod pa'i yid dang; gcig la sogs pa nas lnga'i bar du dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa la spro ba dang / blta bar 'dod pa'i rang bzhin can dang / sad par 'dod pa'i phyir yang sngags kyi don pa rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / der gtod pa'i yid dang; gcig la sogs pa nas lnga'i bar du dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: who are devoted to the practice of mantra, who are of a nature that wishes to see, who wish to awaken, who are without conceptual thoughts about the meaning of mantra, who have a mind focused on that, and who have been initiated into the maṇḍala for one day up to five days.

original: lhag ma ni spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni spang bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be excluded.

original: shes rab can dang / spyod pa la rmongs pa med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa la dbang bskur bar bya yi /
analyzed: shes rab can dang / spyod pa la rmongs pa med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa la dbang bskur bar bya yi /
translated: One should initiate those who are wise, who are endowed with special non-delusion in conduct,

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: but not others.

original: de nas rgyal po thams cad bskur ba bzhin du yo byad thams cad bsogs te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po thams cad bskur ba bzhin du yo byad thams cad bsogs te /
translated: Then, like all kings, one should gather all the necessary articles.

original: slob dpon mkhan po mnyes na /
analyzed: slob dpon mkhan po mnyes na /
translated: If the master and preceptor are pleased,

original: de nas bla re chen po bres te /
analyzed: de nas bla re chen po bres te /
translated: then one should set up a large canopy,

original: rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mthon po bsgreng zhing /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mthon po bsgreng zhing /
translated: erect tall victory banners and flags,

original: gdugs dkar po dbu la 'dzin pa dang / rnga yab dkar pos g-yob pa dang / bkur sti chen pos dung dang / rnga bo che'i dga' ba'i sgra sgrogs shing rgyal ba'i sgra dang / bkra shis kyi tshigs su bcad pa dang / bde legs dang /
analyzed: gdugs dkar po dbu la 'dzin pa dang / rnga yab dkar pos g-yob pa dang / bkur sti chen pos dung dang / rnga bo che'i dga' ba'i sgra sgrogs shing rgyal ba'i sgra dang / bkra shis kyi tshigs su bcad pa dang / bde legs dang /
translated: Holding a white parasol over his head, waving a white yak-tail fan, with great respect, blowing a conch and beating a great drum, with the sound of joy, the sound of the Victorious One, and verses of auspiciousness,

original: rab tu bsngags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rgyal bas gsungs pas mngon par bstod pa dang / dkyil 'khor de la bskor ba byas te /
analyzed: rab tu bsngags pa'i tshigs su bcad pa rgyal bas gsungs pas mngon par bstod pa dang / dkyil 'khor de la bskor ba byas te /
translated: praising with verses of praise spoken by the Victorious Ones, circumambulating that maṇḍala,

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la phyag byas nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la phyag byas nas /
translated: and bowing to the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: say this:

original: slob dpon / bdag ni sangs rgyas @116a *//
analyzed: slob dpon / bdag ni sangs rgyas @116a *//
translated: “Master, I am a buddha

original: dang; byang chub sems dpa'i sngags kyi spyod pa sgrub pa la yang dag par 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i gsang pa'i rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor la yang dag par 'jug pa dang / chos kyi rgyal srid thams cad kyi sangs rgyas nyid rtogs par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: dang; byang chub sems dpa'i sngags kyi spyod pa sgrub pa la yang dag par 'jug pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i gsang pa'i rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor la yang dag par 'jug pa dang / chos kyi rgyal srid thams cad kyi sangs rgyas nyid rtogs par 'dod pa dang /
translated: and to realize the buddhahood of the entire Dharma realm,

original: mdor na / sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na / sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: in short, it should be said for the sake of becoming a buddha.

original: de nas ku sha'i khres la 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas ku sha'i khres la 'dug ste /
translated: Then, sitting on a kuśa mat,

original: shar gyi phyogs su phyogs te dkyil 'khor la blta zhing /
analyzed: shar gyi phyogs su phyogs te dkyil 'khor la blta zhing /
translated: facing east, looking at the maṇḍala,

original: dang por re zhig rig pa'i dbang bskur ba byin te /
analyzed: dang por re zhig rig pa'i dbang bskur ba byin te /
translated: first of all, the empowerment of knowledge should be given.

original: phyag rgya chen po gtsug phud lnga 'ching du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po gtsug phud lnga 'ching du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should bind the five-crested great seal.

original: de nas rang 'dod pa'i sngags gang dang / gang la dga' ba gro ga'i 'dab ma la gi wang gis bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rang 'dod pa'i sngags gang dang / gang la dga' ba gro ga'i 'dab ma la gi wang gis bri bar bya ste /
translated: Then, whatever mantra one desires, and whatever one likes, should be written on a birch bark leaf with bovine bezoar.

original: bris nas kyang tsandan dang / gur gum gyi chus lag pa dang / kham por kha sbyar bkrus la /
analyzed: bris nas kyang tsandan dang / gur gum gyi chus lag pa dang / kham por kha sbyar bkrus la /
translated: Having written it, he should wash his hands and the joined palms with water perfumed with sandalwood and saffron.

original: de nas gro ga'i 'dab ma de kham phor kha sbyar gyi nang du gzhag par byas pa dkyil 'khor gyi nang du byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyi zhabs drung du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gro ga'i 'dab ma de kham phor kha sbyar gyi nang du gzhag par byas pa dkyil 'khor gyi nang du byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyi zhabs drung du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Then he should place that birch bark leaf inside the joined palms, and place it at the feet of the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī inside the maṇḍala.

original: de nas ku sha de la gnas nas rig pa'i rtsa ba'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad snga ma nyid du bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ku sha de la gnas nas rig pa'i rtsa ba'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad snga ma nyid du bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Then, seated on that kuśa grass, he should recite the root vidyā one hundred and eight times beforehand.

original: de nas ku sha'i khres la 'dug pa la dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas ku sha'i khres la 'dug pa la dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: Then, seated on the kuśa bundle, he should be consecrated.

original: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor la gang sems can thams cad @116b dang thun mong du gyur pa'i bum pa gang ba sgo dang nye bar sngar bzhag pa blangs te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor la gang sems can thams cad @116b dang thun mong du gyur pa'i bum pa gang ba sgo dang nye bar sngar bzhag pa blangs te /
translated: In the outer maṇḍala, he should take the filled vase that is shared in common with all sentient beings, which was previously placed near the door,

original: slob dpon gyis rtsa ba'i sngags brjod pas spyi bo nas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rtsa ba'i sngags brjod pas spyi bo nas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: and the master, reciting the root mantra, should consecrate him on the head.

original: gzhan dag la ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i chus so //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni ji ltar 'dod pa'i chus so //
translated: For others, it is with water as desired.

original: de nas kham por kha sbyar de de la sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas kham por kha sbyar de de la sbyin par bya ste /
translated: Then he should give him the joined palms.

original: mar me la klog tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: mar me la klog tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: He should make him recite the mantra in front of the lamp.

original: gal te de nyid yin na ni rim gyis 'bad pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de nyid yin na ni rim gyis 'bad pas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the same, he will accomplish it gradually through effort.

original: yang na ji ste gzhan na ni sngags bzlas pa kho nas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ji ste gzhan na ni sngags bzlas pa kho nas 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or if it is different, he will accomplish it just through mantra recitation.

original: yang na yi ge'i yan lag nyams ba'am /
analyzed: yang na yi ge'i yan lag nyams ba'am /
translated: Or if the syllables are defective,

original: lhag pa byin na ni dang po sgrub pa kho na la 'grub par the tshom med do //
analyzed: lhag pa byin na ni dang po sgrub pa kho na la 'grub par the tshom med do //
translated: or if they are given in excess, he will accomplish it without doubt in the very first performance.

original: de ltar slob dpon gyis sngar bris pa'i sgrub pa gsum gyis nges par 'grub par the tshom med do //
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyis sngar bris pa'i sgrub pa gsum gyis nges par 'grub par the tshom med do //
translated: Thus, the master should definitely accomplish it through the three previously written performances.

original: de bzhin du dang pos ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dang pos ni rig pa'i dbang bskur ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, he should give the initiation of knowledge with the first.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa la dbang bskur ba ni gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor du lha thams cad la bstabs pa'i sngar gyi bum pa des dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa la dbang bskur ba ni gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor du lha thams cad la bstabs pa'i sngar gyi bum pa des dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: The initiation of the second maṇḍala is the initiation given with the previously mentioned vase that is offered to all the deities in the second maṇḍala.

original: spyi po la sngar gyi cho ga ji lta ba de nyid kyis byas na sdig pa'i rnyog pa thams cad las grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi po la sngar gyi cho ga ji lta ba de nyid kyis byas na sdig pa'i rnyog pa thams cad las grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one performs the rite as before, one will be freed from all the impurities of evil.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis gnang zhing /🔽sangs rgyas dang; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi dam tshig dang / dkyil 'khro dang / sngags dang / phyag rgya thams @117a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyis gnang zhing / sangs rgyas dang; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi dam tshig dang / dkyil 'khro dang / sngags dang / phyag rgya thams @117a *//
translated: All the Blessed Buddhas

original: cad sgrub pa la byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur zhing slob dpon du dbang bskur ba sbyin no //
analyzed: cad sgrub pa la byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur zhing slob dpon du dbang bskur ba sbyin no //
translated: and all the Bodhisattvas will grant the consecration of the master, and will bless the accomplishment of all the pledges, mandalas, mantras, and seals of all the worldly and transcendent ones.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum pa la ni rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad la phul ba'i bum pa gang ba de nyid kyi cho gas spyi bo nas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum pa la ni rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad la phul ba'i bum pa gang ba de nyid kyi cho gas spyi bo nas dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: In the third mandala, one should perform the consecration with the very same vase that was offered to all the Pratyekabuddhas and all the Sravakas.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa thams cad kyis 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi sngags rgyud dag 'don pa dang / dkyil 'khor bri ba dang / ston pa dang / phyag rgya dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rdzu 'phrul chen po dang ldan pa thams cad kyis 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi sngags rgyud dag 'don pa dang / dkyil 'khor bri ba dang / ston pa dang / phyag rgya dang /
translated: All the buddhas and all the bodhisattvas endowed with great magical power recite the mantras and tantras of all the mundane and supramundane [deities], draw the mandalas, teach [the mantras], and display the mudras.

original: spyod pa ston pa dang / rang nyid spyod cing ston par khyod la rjes su gnang zhing brjod par bya ba yang tshe 'di nyid la yin la /
analyzed: spyod pa ston pa dang / rang nyid spyod cing ston par khyod la rjes su gnang zhing brjod par bya ba yang tshe 'di nyid la yin la /
translated: They grant you permission to practice and explain [the mantras] in this very life.

original: phyi nas skye ba brgyud pa dag la ni sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi nas skye ba brgyud pa dag la ni sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Later, in subsequent lives, you will attain buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du rgyal ba dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i dbang bskur ba yang sngar bstan pa'i chogs sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sngar phul ba'i bum pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la phul ba'i bum pa gang bas kyang de bzhin du dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal ba dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i dbang bskur ba yang sngar bstan pa'i chogs sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sngar phul ba'i bum pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la phul ba'i bum pa gang bas kyang de bzhin du dbang bskur ro //
translated: Similarly, the victorious and the victorious-consecrated [mudras] are also conferred with the previously explained ritual, with the vase that was previously offered to the Blessed Buddhas and the vase that was offered to the bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang / nyan thos rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya zhing khyod la rjes su gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang / nyan thos rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du brjod par bya zhing khyod la rjes su gnang ba yin no //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, the great bodhisattvas, and the śrāvakas should also say this and give their permission to you.

original: 'byung po thams cad kyis rab tu thub par dka' zhing @117b lus can thams cad kyis mi pham pa dang / sngags pa thams cad las khyod rgyal ba dang / ji ltar 'dod pa sgrubs shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad kyis rab tu thub par dka' zhing @117b lus can thams cad kyis mi pham pa dang / sngags pa thams cad las khyod rgyal ba dang / ji ltar 'dod pa sgrubs shig pa'o //
translated: You are difficult to defeat by all the bhūtas, you are invincible to all embodied beings, you are victorious over all mantra practitioners, and you should accomplish whatever is desired.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis re re la yang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du dbang bskur ba lnga sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis re re la yang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du dbang bskur ba lnga sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then the maṇḍala master should bestow the five consecrations one by one, according to one’s desire.

original: sems can rnams la yang lnga po nyid kyis bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la yang lnga po nyid kyis bya'o //
translated: They should also be done with the five for sentient beings.

original: de dag mthar gyis dkyil 'khor la bcug ste /
analyzed: de dag mthar gyis dkyil 'khor la bcug ste /
translated: Having gradually brought them into the maṇḍala,

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag nyid phul nas dkyil 'khor la bskor ba lan gsum byas te slar gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la bdag nyid phul nas dkyil 'khor la bskor ba lan gsum byas te slar gtang bar bya'o //
translated: having offered oneself to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, one should circumambulate the maṇḍala three times and release them.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nyin zhag la mthar gyis sngags kyi spyod pa la bslab par bya zhing sbyar bar bya'o //🔽skad cig de nyid la bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la sngar phul ba'i bum pa gang ba blangs nas dkyil 'khor du zhugs ba de dag la chu khyor ba gsum shar du mngon par blta bar bya ba la
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nyin zhag la mthar gyis sngags kyi spyod pa la bslab par bya zhing sbyar bar bya'o // skad cig de nyid la bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la sngar phul ba'i bum pa gang ba blangs nas dkyil 'khor du zhugs ba de dag la chu khyor ba gsum shar du mngon par blta bar bya ba la
translated: On other days, one should train in and apply the conduct of mantra gradually.

original: blud par bya'o //
analyzed: blud par bya'o //
translated: At that very moment, the Blessed One should take the filled vase that was previously offered to the youthful Mañjuśrī, the great bodhisattva, and make those who have entered the maṇḍala drink three handfuls of water, facing east.

original: 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du brjod par bya ste /
translated: He should say this:

original: kye / byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i gsang ba'i dam tshig las 'das par gyur nas /
analyzed: kye / byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i gsang ba'i dam tshig las 'das par gyur nas /
translated: “O, do not transgress the secret pledge of the youthful Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa mang po skye bar ma byed cig /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa mang po skye bar ma byed cig /
translated: Do not generate much demerit.

original: sngags thams cad kyang 'dor bar ma byed cig /
analyzed: sngags thams cad kyang 'dor bar ma byed cig /
translated: Do not abandon all mantras.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dag kyang slu bar ma byed cig /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dag kyang slu bar ma byed cig /
translated: Do not deceive the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: bla ma mnyes par gyis shig /
analyzed: bla ma mnyes par gyis shig /
translated: Please the guru.

original: gzhan @118a *// du dam tshig las 'das par gyur na sngags 'grub par mi 'gyur zhing bsod nams ma yin pa mang po 'gyur ro zhes de ltar smras la gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan @118a *// du dam tshig las 'das par gyur na sngags 'grub par mi 'gyur zhing bsod nams ma yin pa mang po 'gyur ro zhes de ltar smras la gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, if one transgresses the commitments, the mantras will not be accomplished and much demerit will accrue.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis kyang zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i s'a lu dang / 'bras thugs po che'i sreg blugs gyis yi ge brgyad pa'i snying po dang; sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis kyang zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar gyis btags pa'i s'a lu dang / 'bras thugs po che'i sreg blugs gyis yi ge brgyad pa'i snying po dang; sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Then the maṇḍala master should also offer oblations of rice and barley grains mixed with curds, honey, and ghee, with the essence mantra of the eight syllables.

original: de nas langs nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su zhugs te /🔽sngar bstan pa'i me tog gis sder bstan pa'i chogs lha thams cad yid la bya ste /
analyzed: de nas langs nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su zhugs te / sngar bstan pa'i me tog gis sder bstan pa'i chogs lha thams cad yid la bya ste /
translated: Then, having risen, he should enter into the center of the maṇḍala.

original: mchod yon dbul lo //
analyzed: mchod yon dbul lo //
translated: Visualizing all the deities with the previously explained flowers, he should mentally offer water for welcoming.

original: bdug pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa nyan thos thams cad dang / lha dang; klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / dri za dang / mi 'am ci dang /
analyzed: bdug pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa nyan thos thams cad dang / lha dang; klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / dri za dang / mi 'am ci dang /
translated: Having fumigated with incense all the buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, noble śrāvakas, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, garuḍas, gandharvas, kinnaras,

original: lto 'phye chen po dang / srin po dang / sha za dang / 'byung po dang / rnal 'byor pa dang; grub pa dang / drang srong rnams dang / sems can thams cad yang dag par bdug nas me tog gtor te /
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po dang / srin po dang / sha za dang / 'byung po dang / rnal 'byor pa dang; grub pa dang / drang srong rnams dang / sems can thams cad yang dag par bdug nas me tog gtor te /
translated: mahoragas, rākṣasas, piśācas, bhūtas, yogins, siddhas, ṛṣis, and all beings, scatter flowers.

original: tsandan dang / gur gum gyis bsangs la sngar bstan pa'i chogs slar gshegs su gsol bar bya ste /
analyzed: tsandan dang / gur gum gyis bsangs la sngar bstan pa'i chogs slar gshegs su gsol bar bya ste /
translated: Having fumigated with sandalwood and saffron, request the departure with the previously explained ritual.

original: sems kyis thams cad gtang ba yin no //
analyzed: sems kyis thams cad gtang ba yin no //
translated: Everything is mentally relinquished.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis bsho sa dang / gtor ma @118b dang / sa tshon thams cad chu bor dor bar bya ba 'am /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis bsho sa dang / gtor ma @118b dang / sa tshon thams cad chu bor dor bar bya ba 'am /
translated: Then the maṇḍala master should cast the bali and the colored powders into the river,

original: srog chags sdug bsngal ba rnams la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: srog chags sdug bsngal ba rnams la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should give to those who are suffering.

original: sa phyogs de legs par byugs shing 'jam par byas te /
analyzed: sa phyogs de legs par byugs shing 'jam par byas te /
translated: One should smear that place well and make it smooth.

original: legs par phyag pa byas nas ba lang gi lci bas byug tu gzhug pa'am /
analyzed: legs par phyag pa byas nas ba lang gi lci bas byug tu gzhug pa'am /
translated: Having swept it well, one should have it smeared with cow dung,

original: chus byug par bya ba 'am /🔽shin tu gtsang ba'i sas byug pa'am /
analyzed: chus byug par bya ba 'am / shin tu gtsang ba'i sas byug pa'am /
translated: or smeared with water,🔽or smeared with very clean earth,

original: bye mas gtor bar byas la /
analyzed: bye mas gtor bar byas la /
translated: or sprinkled with sand.

original: de nas ji ltar 'dod par 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas ji ltar 'dod par 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should go there as one wishes.

original: dkyil 'khor la zhugs pa des bdag nyid 'o ma dang / 'bras zan gyi zas sam /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la zhugs pa des bdag nyid 'o ma dang / 'bras zan gyi zas sam /
translated: That one who has entered the maṇḍala should eat food of milk and rice,

original: lha la dbul ba'i kha zas bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha la dbul ba'i kha zas bza' bar bya'o //
translated: or food that is to be offered to the deity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po'i dbang po las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod cho ga zhib mo'i rgyal po'i dbang po las /
translated: From the Bodhisattva-piṭaka-tantra-rāja-indrāṇī,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa byang chub sems dpa'i le'u rab 'byams las /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa byang chub sems dpa'i le'u rab 'byams las /
translated: in the chapter of the infinite bodhisattva emanations of Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga bstan pa ste /
translated: the maṇḍala ritual is taught.

original: le'u gnyis pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa rdzogs so ////
translated: Chapter two is complete.

original: de nas / gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas / gzhan yang /
translated: Then, furthermore,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas gnas gtsang ma'i gzhal med khang gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po 'dus pa la gzigs nas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas gnas gtsang ma'i gzhal med khang gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po 'dus pa la gzigs nas /
translated: The youthful Mañjuśrī, having looked at the great assembly of the retinue in the palace of the Pure Abodes,

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag btsal te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag btsal te /
translated: bowed to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: yi ge gcig pa mchog tu gsang ba /
analyzed: yi ge gcig pa mchog tu gsang ba /
translated: and spoke the supreme secret of the single syllable,

original: dug thams cad 'joms par byed pa /
analyzed: dug thams cad 'joms par byed pa /
translated: the destroyer of all poisons,

original: las thams cad byed pa /
analyzed: las thams cad byed pa /
translated: the performer of all actions,

original: sngags dang / dkyil 'khor chung ngu sgrub pa'i thabs dang / las phran tshegs thams cad la nye bar sbyar bar bya ba smras so //
analyzed: sngags dang / dkyil 'khor chung ngu sgrub pa'i thabs dang / las phran tshegs thams cad la nye bar sbyar bar bya ba smras so //
translated: the means of accomplishing the small mantra and maṇḍala, and the application to all minor activities.

original: @119a *// de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: @119a *// de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: na ma: sa manta bud dh'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma: sa manta bud dh'a n'am/
translated: Homage to all the buddhas!

original: tadya th'a / aom dza /
analyzed: tadya th'a / aom dza /
translated: Tadyathā: Oṃ jaḥ.

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: Friends,

original: 'di ni 'byung po thams cad nyon cig /
analyzed: 'di ni 'byung po thams cad nyon cig /
translated: all bhūtas, listen!

original: sngags 'di nyid ni yi ge gcig gi dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i cho ga thams cad du dgos pa /
analyzed: sngags 'di nyid ni yi ge gcig gi dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i cho ga thams cad du dgos pa /
translated: This mantra is the single syllable, necessary for all the rites of the second maṇḍala,

original: khru brgyad dam /
analyzed: khru brgyad dam /
translated: eight cubits or

original: khru bzhi sa'i phyogs yang dag par byas la /
analyzed: khru bzhi sa'i phyogs yang dag par byas la /
translated: four cubits in size, in a well-prepared place.

original: tshon sna lnga'i phye mas rang nyid kyis bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i phye mas rang nyid kyis bri bar bya ste /
translated: One should draw it oneself with five-colored powders,

original: gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: not others.

original: gang de dang / de dag tu'ang 'dir ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: gang de dang / de dag tu'ang 'dir ni nges pa med do //
translated: Here there is no certainty in those and those.

original: dkyil 'khor gru bzhi mnyam pos nye bar mdzes pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gru bzhi mnyam pos nye bar mdzes pa /
translated: The maṇḍala is beautifully adorned with four equal sides.

original: gtsug phud lnga'i phyag rgya chen po dang por re zhig bri'o //
analyzed: gtsug phud lnga'i phyag rgya chen po dang por re zhig bri'o //
translated: First, one should draw the great five-crested mudrā.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i autpa la'i phyag rgya dang / mche ba'i phyag rgya dang / zhal gyi phyag rgya dang / dbug pa'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i autpa la'i phyag rgya dang / mche ba'i phyag rgya dang / zhal gyi phyag rgya dang / dbug pa'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: The mudrās of the blessed youthful Mañjuśrī are the utpala mudrā, the tusk mudrā, the face mudrā, and the goad mudrā.

original: phyag rgya 'di dag dkyil 'khor gyi nang du shar gyi char bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'di dag dkyil 'khor gyi nang du shar gyi char bri bar bya'o //
translated: These mudrās should be drawn inside the maṇḍala in the east.

original: de nas padma dang / rdo rje dang / autpa la dang phyag mtshan dang / ba dan dang / gdugs dang / rta babs dang / shing rta dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / glang dang / ma he dang / sva sti ka dang /
analyzed: de nas padma dang / rdo rje dang / autpa la dang phyag mtshan dang / ba dan dang / gdugs dang / rta babs dang / shing rta dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / glang dang / ma he dang / sva sti ka dang /
translated: Then, one should draw lotuses, vajras, utpalas, hand implements, banners, parasols, gateways, chariots, elephants, horses, bulls, buffaloes, and swastikas.

original: rma bya dang / ra dang / lug dang / skyes bu gzhon nu'i gzugs can phyi rol gyi sgo'i rtsa bar bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: rma bya dang / ra dang / lug dang / skyes bu gzhon nu'i gzugs can phyi rol gyi sgo'i rtsa bar bri bar bya ste /
translated: One should draw a peacock, a goat, a sheep, and a youthful man at the base of the outer door.

original: mthar gyis rim pa la brten nas bris te /
analyzed: mthar gyis rim pa la brten nas bris te /
translated: One should draw them in sequence, in dependence on the stages.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum la brten nas de ltar bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum la brten nas de ltar bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should draw them in this way in dependence on the three maṇḍalas.

original: de nas yi ge gcig pa'i sngags nyid kyis shar lho'i @119b phyogs kyi char me'i las bya ste /
analyzed: de nas yi ge gcig pa'i sngags nyid kyis shar lho'i @119b phyogs kyi char me'i las bya ste /
translated: “Then, in the southeast quarter, one should perform the fire rite with the one-syllable mantra.

original: shing aa pa mrga'i yam shing zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar la btags pas stong rtsa brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: shing aa pa mrga'i yam shing zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar la btags pas stong rtsa brgyad sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should offer into the fire one thousand and eight oblations of sticks of the crown flower plant smeared with curds, honey, and ghee.

original: de nas me tog gi mchod yon dbul lo //
analyzed: de nas me tog gi mchod yon dbul lo //
translated: Then one should offer a flower libation.

original: yi ge gcig pa'i sngags nyid kyis ji ltar 'dod par gtor ma dang / lha bshos dang / mar me dang / bdug pa dang / spyan drang ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba rnams bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge gcig pa'i sngags nyid kyis ji ltar 'dod par gtor ma dang / lha bshos dang / mar me dang / bdug pa dang / spyan drang ba dang / gshegs su gsol ba rnams bya'o //
translated: With the one-syllable mantra, one should offer sacrificial food, eatables, lamps, incense, and invite and dismiss them as one wishes.

original: de nas rgyal srid 'dod pas ni grong khyer gyi dbus su bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rgyal srid 'dod pas ni grong khyer gyi dbus su bri bar bya'o //
translated: “Then, one who desires a kingdom should draw it in the middle of a city.

original: longs spyod 'dod pas ni shing aa mra'i drung du'o //
analyzed: longs spyod 'dod pas ni shing aa mra'i drung du'o //
translated: If one desires wealth, then in front of a mango tree.🔽If one desires a son, then in front of a bodhi tree.

original: bu 'dod pas ni bo de rtse'i shing gi drung du'o; ;chung ma dang / glang po che dang / rta 'dod pas ni glang po che'i bres skyu'am /🔽rta'i bres skyur ro //🔽chu 'dod pas ni mtsho chen po'am /
analyzed: bu 'dod pas ni bo de rtse'i shing gi drung du'o; ;chung ma dang / glang po che dang / rta 'dod pas ni glang po che'i bres skyu'am / rta'i bres skyur ro // chu 'dod pas ni mtsho chen po'am /
translated: If one desires a wife, an elephant, or a horse, then in front of a stable for elephants or horses.

original: klu'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: klu'i gnas su'o //
translated: If one desires water, then in a great lake or in the abode of the nāgas.

original: nyin bzhi pa'i rims sam; rtag pa'i rims sam /
analyzed: nyin bzhi pa'i rims sam; rtag pa'i rims sam /
translated: If one is afflicted by a fever of four days or by a chronic fever,

original: rims thams cad la rtags gcig pa'am /
analyzed: rims thams cad la rtags gcig pa'am /
translated: or by any other fever, then in a place where there is a single caitya.

original: grong gi g-yas phyogs su'o //🔽srin pos zin pa la ni dur khrod dam /
analyzed: grong gi g-yas phyogs su'o // srin pos zin pa la ni dur khrod dam /
translated: If one is afflicted by a graha, then in a village.

original: khang pa stong par bya'o //🔽yang srin pos zin pa la ni ba ru ra'i shing gi drung ngam /
analyzed: khang pa stong par bya'o // yang srin pos zin pa la ni ba ru ra'i shing gi drung ngam /
translated: If one is afflicted by a piśāca, then in a cemetery or in an empty house.

original: ae randa'i shing gi drung du bya'o //🔽ma mo thams cad kyis zin pa la ni bzhi mdo 'am /
analyzed: ae randa'i shing gi drung du bya'o // ma mo thams cad kyis zin pa la ni bzhi mdo 'am /
translated: If one is afflicted by a rākṣasa, then in front of a banyan tree or in front of an eranda plant.

original: shi ba'i khyim dang / bu btsas pa'i khyim du nye bar bya'o //
analyzed: shi ba'i khyim dang / bu btsas pa'i khyim du nye bar bya'o //
translated: If one is afflicted by all the mātṛs, then at a crossroads or in the house of a dead person or in the house of a newborn baby.

original: tshangs pa'i srin pos zin pa la ta la'i shing du'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i srin pos zin pa la ta la'i shing du'o //
translated: If one is afflicted by the rākṣasa Brahmā, then in front of a palm tree.

original: sbyar ba'i dug 'byin pa la ni yi ge gcig pa'i sngags kyis chu la lan gsum sngags pa bya ste /🔽dkyil 'khor de @120a *//
analyzed: sbyar ba'i dug 'byin pa la ni yi ge gcig pa'i sngags kyis chu la lan gsum sngags pa bya ste / dkyil 'khor de @120a *//
translated: For the removal of poison from the body, one should incant water with the one-syllable mantra three times.

original: nyid du blud pa byas na grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid du blud pa byas na grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes [the patient] drink it in that very maṇḍala, he will be freed.

original: de bzhin du bud med dam /
analyzed: de bzhin du bud med dam /
translated: Similarly, for a woman

original: skyes pa grags pa 'dod pa la ni bzhi mdo 'am /🔽bram ze gnas par bri bar bya'o; ;bu shi ba la ni shing 'bras bu can nam /
analyzed: skyes pa grags pa 'dod pa la ni bzhi mdo 'am / bram ze gnas par bri bar bya'o; ;bu shi ba la ni shing 'bras bu can nam /
translated: or a man who desires fame, one should draw [the maṇḍala] at a crossroads

original: 'o ma can gyis shing drung du'o //
analyzed: 'o ma can gyis shing drung du'o //
translated: or in a brahmin's abode. For one whose child has died, [one should draw it] at the foot of a tree bearing fruit or milk.

original: 'bras s'a lu smin pa'i sa dang / zhing gi dbus su ni bu med pa la bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras s'a lu smin pa'i sa dang / zhing gi dbus su ni bu med pa la bri bar bya'o //
translated: For one without a son, one should draw [the maṇḍala] in a field in the middle of a field of ripe rice.

original: nad rnam pa gsum bdag gir byas pa dang / gzhan gyis nyams pa la ni 'jug dogs la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: nad rnam pa gsum bdag gir byas pa dang / gzhan gyis nyams pa la ni 'jug dogs la sogs pa la'o //
translated: For one who has taken on three types of illness and for one who has been harmed by others, [one should draw it] in a place such as a crossroads.

original: nad chen pos btab pa la ni dkyil 'khor chu bo'i ngogs dang / 'gram du bya'o //
analyzed: nad chen pos btab pa la ni dkyil 'khor chu bo'i ngogs dang / 'gram du bya'o //
translated: For one afflicted by a great illness, one should make the maṇḍala on the bank or shore of a river.

original: nad thams cad kyis thams cad du btab pa la ni ri'i rtse mor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: nad thams cad kyis thams cad du btab pa la ni ri'i rtse mor bri bar bya'o //
translated: For one afflicted by all illnesses in every way, one should draw [the maṇḍala] on a mountain peak.

original: mkha' 'gro mas byas pa la yang bram ze'i ldum ra 'am /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro mas byas pa la yang bram ze'i ldum ra 'am /
translated: One should also do it in a Brahmin garden,

original: khang pa stong pa 'am /
analyzed: khang pa stong pa 'am /
translated: an empty house,

original: gnas dben pa gzhol pa'i sa phyogs su bya'o //🔽de bzhin du las thams cad la nam phyed dam /
analyzed: gnas dben pa gzhol pa'i sa phyogs su bya'o // de bzhin du las thams cad la nam phyed dam /
translated: or a secluded place.🔽Likewise, all the rites should be performed at midnight

original: dus thams cad du mngon par bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du mngon par bri bar bya'o //
translated: or at any time.

original: yi ge gcig ba de nyid kyi sngags kyis me tog gi mchod yon phul te gshegs su gsol la /
analyzed: yi ge gcig ba de nyid kyi sngags kyis me tog gi mchod yon phul te gshegs su gsol la /
translated: One should offer a flower libation with the mantra of that very one-syllable [mantra], and request [the deity] to depart.

original: dkyil 'khor la chus gtor ba byas na nad thams cad bsrung ba chen pos byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la chus gtor ba byas na nad thams cad bsrung ba chen pos byas par 'gyur te /
translated: If one sprinkles the maṇḍala with water, one will be protected from all illnesses,

original: nad thams cad las grol bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad thams cad las grol bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and one will be freed from all illnesses.

original: bu med pas ni bu rnyed cing //
analyzed: bu med pas ni bu rnyed cing //
translated: One without a son will find a son,

original: skal med rnams kyang skal ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: skal med rnams kyang skal ldan 'gyur //
translated: and the unfortunate will become fortunate.

original: dbul po rnams kyis nor thob pa //
analyzed: dbul po rnams kyis nor thob pa //
translated: The poor will obtain wealth

original: dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam @120b gyis so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor mthong ba tsam @120b gyis so //
translated: merely by seeing the maṇḍala.

original: skyes pa'am yang na bud med kyang //
analyzed: skyes pa'am yang na bud med kyang //
translated: Whether a man or a woman,

original: thos nas the tshom med byas na //
analyzed: thos nas the tshom med byas na //
translated: having heard [this], one should be free of doubt.

original: ci 'dod rnam pa sna tshogs ni //
analyzed: ci 'dod rnam pa sna tshogs ni //
translated: Whatever one desires, of various kinds,

original: thob 'gyur rtag tu phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: thob 'gyur rtag tu phun sum tshogs //
translated: One will always obtain perfection.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi cho ga rab 'byams las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod kyi cho ga rab 'byams las /
translated: From the extensive ritual of the Bodhisattva Canon,

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur ba'i rtsa ba las kyi dkyil 'khor gsum pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste gsum pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur ba'i rtsa ba las kyi dkyil 'khor gsum pa'i cho ga'i le'u ste gsum pa rdzogs so ////
translated: the third chapter of the ritual of the root maṇḍala of Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, is completed.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas thams cad dang ldan pa'i gnas gtsang ma la gzigs nas /
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas thams cad dang ldan pa'i gnas gtsang ma la gzigs nas /
translated: Then Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, looked at the entire realm of the Pure Abode,

original: gzhan yang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po der 'dus pa la yang gzigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor chen po der 'dus pa la yang gzigs te /
translated: and also looked at the assembly gathered in the great maṇḍala,

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i zhabs gnyis la bcud nas zhal 'dzum pa dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i zhabs gnyis la bcud nas zhal 'dzum pa dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and bowed to the feet of the Blessed Śākyamuni. With a smiling face, he said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One!

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir sngags kyi spyod pa'i cho ga sgrub pa'i rgyu mthun pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir sngags kyi spyod pa'i cho ga sgrub pa'i rgyu mthun pa /
translated: For the benefit of all sentient beings, the concordant cause for accomplishing the ritual of mantra conduct,

original: chos kyi char ji ltar 'dod pa'i 'bras bu sgrub pa'i cho ga rab 'byams las /
analyzed: chos kyi char ji ltar 'dod pa'i 'bras bu sgrub pa'i cho ga rab 'byams las /
translated: the extensive ritual for accomplishing the rain of Dharma, the fruit as desired,

original: ras kyi ri mo'i cho ga bsod nams bla na med pa bskyed pa /
analyzed: ras kyi ri mo'i cho ga bsod nams bla na med pa bskyed pa /
translated: The ritual of the cloth painting generates unsurpassed merit.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sa bon mngon par sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sa bon mngon par sgrub par byed pa /
translated: It accomplishes the seed of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: mdor na / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: mdor na / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: In short, it fulfills all wishes.

original: sngags thams cad kyi 'bras bu la rab tu sbyor zhing 'bras bu dang bcas par byed pa /
analyzed: sngags thams cad kyi 'bras bu la rab tu sbyor zhing 'bras bu dang bcas par byed pa /
translated: It connects to the result of all mantras and makes them fruitful.

original: don med pa ma yin pa grub cing sgrub par byed pa /🔽byang chub sems dpa' @121a *//
analyzed: don med pa ma yin pa grub cing sgrub par byed pa / byang chub sems dpa' @121a *//
translated: It is not meaningless, and it accomplishes and establishes.

original: thams cad kyi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: It perfects the conduct of all bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i go cha bgos pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i go cha bgos pa /
translated: It is the armor of the great bodhisattvas.

original: bdud thams cad kyi stobs zil gyis mnan cing rgyab kyis phyogs par byed pa /
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyi stobs zil gyis mnan cing rgyab kyis phyogs par byed pa /
translated: It overpowers and turns away all māras.

original: bdag dang / sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba'i phyir de legs par bshad du gsol /
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba'i phyir de legs par bshad du gsol /
translated: Please teach it out of compassion for me and all sentient beings.”

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas de skad ces gsol ba dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas de skad ces gsol ba dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When the youthful Mañjuśrī made this request, the Blessed Śākyamuni then said this to the youthful Mañjuśrī:

original: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa /
translated: Excellent, Mañjuśrī!

original: khyod skye bo mang po la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba'i phyir gang khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di 'dri bar sems pa ni legs so //
analyzed: khyod skye bo mang po la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba'i phyir gang khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di 'dri bar sems pa ni legs so //
translated: You who are engaged for the benefit of many beings and out of compassion for the world, it is excellent that you have thought to ask the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: legs so // de shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang ngas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: legs so // de shin tu legs par nyon la yid la zungs shig dang ngas bshad par bya'o //
translated: Listen well and keep it in mind, I will explain it.

original: khyod kyi ras ris kyi cho ga rab 'byams sngags thams cad sgrub par byed pa la rab tu 'jug pa mthar gyis ngas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi ras ris kyi cho ga rab 'byams sngags thams cad sgrub par byed pa la rab tu 'jug pa mthar gyis ngas bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will explain to you the extensive ritual of the painting, the means of accomplishing all mantras, the gradual engagement.

original: sngon yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bstan te da ltar yang ngas bshad par bya'o; ;dang por re zhig sa'i phyogs gtsang ba rdul med pa las ras bal yang dag par blangs la /
analyzed: sngon yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bstan te da ltar yang ngas bshad par bya'o; ;dang por re zhig sa'i phyogs gtsang ba rdul med pa las ras bal yang dag par blangs la /
translated: First, in a clean and dust-free place, take pure cotton

original: dam tshig la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyis ras bal de yang @121b dag par dag par byas te /
analyzed: dam tshig la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyis ras bal de yang @121b dag par dag par byas te /
translated: and have beings who have entered the samaya purify that cotton.

original: yang sngags 'dis dkyil 'khor gyis brgya rtsa brgyad du sngags par bya'o //
analyzed: yang sngags 'dis dkyil 'khor gyis brgya rtsa brgyad du sngags par bya'o //
translated: Again, with this mantra, it should be enchanted one hundred and eight times with the maṇḍala.

original: na ma:sa manta bud dh'a n'am/
analyzed: na ma:sa manta bud dh'a n'am/
translated: Namo samanta buddhānām.

original: bo dhi satva aa pra ti ha ta ga ti ma ti pra ts'a ri n'am/
analyzed: bo dhi satva aa pra ti ha ta ga ti ma ti pra ts'a ri n'am/
translated: Bodhisattvāpratihata gati mati pracarinām.

original: na ma:sam sho dha na du:kha pra sha ma nendra r'a dz'a ya /
analyzed: na ma:sam sho dha na du:kha pra sha ma nendra r'a dz'a ya /
translated: Namaḥ saṃśodhana duḥkha praśamanendrarāja.

original: ta th'a ga t'a ya /
analyzed: ta th'a ga t'a ya /
translated: Tathāgatāya.

original: aarha te samya ssam bud dh'a ya /
analyzed: aarha te samya ssam bud dh'a ya /
translated: Arhate samyaksaṃbuddhāya.

original: ta dya th'a /
analyzed: ta dya th'a /
translated: Tadyathā.

original: aom sho dha ya sam sho dha ya /
analyzed: aom sho dha ya sam sho dha ya /
translated: Oṃ śodhaya śodhaya.

original: sarba bighnam gha ta ka ma h'a k'a ru ni ka ku m'a ra r'u pa dha ri ni /
analyzed: sarba bighnam gha ta ka ma h'a k'a ru ni ka ku m'a ra r'u pa dha ri ni /
translated: Sarva vighaṃ gata mahākaruṇikakumārarūpadhāriṇi.

original: bi kurba bi kurba /
analyzed: bi kurba bi kurba /
translated: Vikurva vikurva.

original: sa ma ya ma nu sma ra tishtha tishtha h'um h'um phad phad sv'ah'a /
analyzed: sa ma ya ma nu sma ra tishtha tishtha h'um h'um phad phad sv'ah'a /
translated: Samaya manushmara tistha tistha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: de nas grong gi chos mi shes pa'i gzhon nu ma bram ze'i rigs dang / rgyal rigs su skyes pa dang / rje'u'i rigs su skyes pa dang / rigs ngan pa'i skye gnas yongs su spangs pa /
analyzed: de nas grong gi chos mi shes pa'i gzhon nu ma bram ze'i rigs dang / rgyal rigs su skyes pa dang / rje'u'i rigs su skyes pa dang / rigs ngan pa'i skye gnas yongs su spangs pa /
translated: Then, a young woman who does not know the ways of the village, born into a brahmin family, a kṣatriya family, a vaiśya family, or a family of low birth,

original: dbang po mtshang ba med pa /
analyzed: dbang po mtshang ba med pa /
translated: who is not defective in her faculties,

original: yan lag thams cad mdzes pa /
analyzed: yan lag thams cad mdzes pa /
translated: who is beautiful in all her limbs,

original: pha dang / mas rjes su gnang ba /
analyzed: pha dang / mas rjes su gnang ba /
translated: who has the permission of her father and mother,

original: gso sbyong byas pa /
analyzed: gso sbyong byas pa /
translated: who has taken the purificatory fast,

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa /
translated: who has generated the mind of awakening,

original: snying rje dang ldan pa /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa /
translated: who is compassionate,

original: bzhin dkar ba /
analyzed: bzhin dkar ba /
translated: who is fair-faced,

original: kha dog gzhan rnam par spangs pa /
analyzed: kha dog gzhan rnam par spangs pa /
translated: who has abandoned other complexions,

original: mdor na / bud med kyi mtshan nyid rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan pa /
analyzed: mdor na / bud med kyi mtshan nyid rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan pa /
translated: in short, who is characterized by the characteristics of a woman’s complete peacefulness,

original: shin tu nyin zhag shis pa dang / zla ba yar ngo dang / gza' bzang po bltas te /
analyzed: shin tu nyin zhag shis pa dang / zla ba yar ngo dang / gza' bzang po bltas te /
translated: on an auspicious day, during the waxing moon, under a beneficent constellation,

original: du ba dang / khug rna med cing sprin dang bral ba /
analyzed: du ba dang / khug rna med cing sprin dang bral ba /
translated: without smoke or fog, free of clouds,

original: rlung med cing gtsang ba'i sa phyogs su sngar bstan pa'i gzhon nu ma khrus byas shing gos gtsang ma bgos te /
analyzed: rlung med cing gtsang ba'i sa phyogs su sngar bstan pa'i gzhon nu ma khrus byas shing gos gtsang ma bgos te /
translated: In a place that is free of wind and clean, the previously described young woman should bathe and put on clean clothes.

original: gos kyi legs par bkab pa byas pa la sngags 'di phyag @122a *//
analyzed: gos kyi legs par bkab pa byas pa la sngags 'di phyag @122a *//
translated: Having covered herself well with clothes, she should be protected with this mantra

original: rgya chen po dang ldan pas bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgya chen po dang ldan pas bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: and the great mudrā.🔽Having mixed white sandalwood and saffron with water free of living organisms, that cotton and that girl should be purified with that very mantra and scattered.

original: tsandan dkar po dang / gur gum srog chags med pa'i chu dang sbyar bas ras bal de dang / bu mo de sngags de nyid kyis yang dag par sbyangs te gtor la tsandan dkar po dang / gur gum gyi chus steng dang / 'og dang /
analyzed: tsandan dkar po dang / gur gum srog chags med pa'i chu dang sbyar bas ras bal de dang / bu mo de sngags de nyid kyis yang dag par sbyangs te gtor la tsandan dkar po dang / gur gum gyi chus steng dang / 'og dang /
translated: One should scatter water with white sandalwood and saffron above, below,

original: phyogs bzhir yang gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir yang gtor bar bya'o //
translated: and in the four directions.

original: tsandan dkar po dang / gur gum dang / ga bur gcig tu byas pa'i bdug pas bdugs par bya ste /
analyzed: tsandan dkar po dang / gur gum dang / ga bur gcig tu byas pa'i bdug pas bdugs par bya ste /
translated: One should burn incense made from white sandalwood, saffron, and camphor together.

original: rang nyid kyis sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis sbyin pa'am /
translated: Either oneself or

original: sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gi slob dpon gyis sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i grogs mchog gi slob dpon gyis sbyin par bya'o //
translated: the master who is the excellent friend of practice should give it.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / sa bcu'i dbang phyug la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / sa bcu'i dbang phyug la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas and the great bodhisattvas who are lords of the ten stages,

original: ras kyi dog pa 'di la lhag par gnas par mdzod cig ces lan gsum brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ras kyi dog pa 'di la lhag par gnas par mdzod cig ces lan gsum brjod par bya'o //
translated: may they all abide in this cloth!🔽Then, having said, “May the Blessed Buddhas and the great bodhisattvas pay heed!”

original: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dgongs su gsol zhes byas nas bdug pas bdug pa de'i dus su rma bya dang / khrung khrung dang / ngang pa dang / bzhad dang / ngur pa rnam pa sna tshogs bya dge ba thang la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dgongs su gsol zhes byas nas bdug pas bdug pa de'i dus su rma bya dang / khrung khrung dang / ngang pa dang / bzhad dang / ngur pa rnam pa sna tshogs bya dge ba thang la gnas pa'am /
translated: at that time, if various auspicious birds such as peacocks, cranes, geese, swans, and Brahmani ducks, whether dwelling on the ground or

original: chu la spyod pa rnams nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: chu la spyod pa rnams nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: moving in the water, fly in the sky,

original: dge ba'i skad 'don na las 'di ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes sgrub pa @122b pos shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i skad 'don na las 'di ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes sgrub pa @122b pos shes par bya'o //
translated: or if they make auspicious sounds, the practitioner should understand that this action is accompanied by results.
